characters: VARIETY OF SHOTS SHOWING THE POLITICAL AND ECONOMIC CLIMA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOON and it’s vivid glow are seen rising in seamless lapse photography over the endless undulating body of wat We hear an excerpt from THE CONGO by Vachel Lindsay.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES
dialogues.text: Boomlay, boomlay, boom. Beware, walk with care, Boomlay, boomlay, boom. We are, we are all sinners, Yet purer than sin. Boomlay, boomlay, BOOM.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOONLIGHT reflects off the calm dark body of water. W in the distance FAINT LIGHTS on shore indicate a hint of PIRATE LAIR known as HARARDHERE. The outline of an anchor 25,000 ton CARGO SHIP (THE CHEMSTAR) is barely discernibl EXT. CHEMSTAR —- NIGHT A 25 FOOT POWER BOAT pulls along side the ship and FIFTEE ARMED PIRATES aggressively scramble up several HANGING RO LADDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this action is seen through the lens of THERMAL NIGHT VISION GOGGLES. Locked into the PIRATE'S ‘body heat signature,’ the GOGGLES ramp in tighter on the THIEVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy DOOR to a large unit STORAGE ROOM swings open revealing the kidnapped crew. They are thoroughly exhaust and suffering from dehydration. In very tight unsteady angles we see glimpses of the SOMA PIRATES charging into the room and yanking hostages to th feet. Some are savagely kicked and jerked upright by KNOT ROPES that are wrapped around their necks. They plead for mercy through their GAGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIP’S STAIRCASE The DARK METAL STAIRCASE reverberates loudly as frenetic SHAFTS OF LIGHT from the PIRATES’ FLASHLIGHTS cut through gloom as the BOUND HOSTAGES are kicked and shoved down to the bowels of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only sound heard is the LAPPING WAVES that strike the ship’s side. The TETHERED PIRATES’ BOAT is seen in the foreground again, through THERMAL VISION GOGGLES, the ‘Thermal Vision POV’ moves steadily closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUND HOSTAGES are being shoved and kicked into the center of the ship’s HOLD. High above the HOLD are open C DOORS that reveal the dark night sky. TWO PIRATES stand g above the ‘HOLD’ watching the HOSTAGES being abused below Waiting in the hold are another FIFTEEN PIRATES who are sitting on STACKS OF CARGO drinking and smoking. The whol environment has the feel of a distorted amphitheater whos attendees want blood. SHIP’S HOLD The HOSTAGES are dragged into the center of the METAL CAR AREA. The PIRATES mock their pleas for ‘help’ and burning CIGARETTES and empty BEER BOTTLES are tossed at the FRENC MEN. The surly PIRATES pass around large joints of MARIJU while gyrating on the STACKED CARGO.

dialogues.speaker: SHIPS UPPER DECK
dialogues.text: Ultra Extreme CLOSE UP of a THERMAL VISION GOGGLES LENS a rises into view. The individual wearing them is not seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panning around we see the DECK is clear. The THERMAL VISI then scans the UPPER DECK of the ship and this area is al clear. The THERMAL VISION IMAGE now travels forward toward the C HOLD. A PIRATE GUARD seated on the EDGE of the cargo hold observing below.  10 13 14 15

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 3
dialogues.text: SHIP’S HOLD The PIRATE LEADER bellows orders and the PIRATE CREW kick HOSTAGES to their knees, while dragging them into a strai line. The majority of the surrounding PIRATES hurl insult The LEADER orders another PIRATE holding a small VIDEO CA to begin filming. Around them are STACKS of the cargo, wh is SALT. The LEADER paces behind the doomed HOSTAGES and begins to speak in English, which is the SOMALI’S second language.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (accented English) We had these men too long! Three months! Too, too long! Now someone here (eyes the hostages) has to pay! Your company has had so much time to pay! But you give nothing!! You do not care about your people. Don’t want them? Then we do not care!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LEADER angrily gestures to the PIRATE beside him. The PIRATE disdainfully drags a HOSTAGE forward and yanks bound hands upward. The GAGGED HOSTAGE’S muffled cries for mercy fall on deaf ears. The PIRATE GANG clamors for blood.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (playing to the camera) These workers need their hands! But the owners of this ship do not want to pay! That means to me that you do not care for these men anymore. We do not care too. SHIP’S DECK The THERMAL VISION POV continues to close in on the edge the CARGO HOLD. INT. — CARGO HOLD The PIRATE LEADER has stepped in front of the cowering HOSTAGE.  17

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (outraged) The blood they bleed is for you to see! The LEADER raises a huge MACHETE from another PIRATE. SHIP’S HOLD The MACHETE is about to descend when they are startled by yell followed by a BLACK NYLON BAG that crashes heavily t the ship’s floor. Full of adrenaline, the PIRATES aim their array of WEAPON upward and are about to fire when the RED BEAM from a LAS LIGHT appears on the LEADER’S CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (to his men) No! (in Somali) Don’t shoot!! Who is there? The PIRATE with the PORTABLE CAMERA pans upward. It recor the barely discernible OUTLINES of SIX DARKLY CLAD MEN. ( camera’s footage will be haphazardly recorded and used in later scene.) EXT. SHIP’S DECK - NIGHT The SIX MERCENARIES gathered around the ship’s HOLD are k as THE EXPENDABLES. BARNEY ROSS: Group leader and strategist. In his day a re holder for his blinding speed and accuracy with COMBAT PISTOLS. HALE CAESAR: Long Barrel Weapon Specialist, especially custom, one of a kind, full-auto shotguns. Well-adjusted, pleasant, outspoken, but ruthless in battle, friends with BARNEY for 10 years. LEE CHRISTMAS: Former SAS and a savant with anything that a blade. YING YANG: Thoughtful, deadly and a master at ‘close quar combat.’ He’s a man who’s always meditating on how he sho live his life. TOLL ROAD: His imposing size and battle scarred appearanc belie his special DEMOLITION SKILLS and calm intellect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When all else fails, he simply employs his brutal but brilliant fighting capabilities to shatter every bone in opponent’s body. He wears special GLOVES with protruding STUDS and METAL KNEE PADS. GUNNAR JENSEN: A big combat veteran who’s an expert in PRECISION SNIPING, but the years of stress, isolation and cynicism have spiraled him downwards into an unwinnable w of substance abuse and untamable mood swings. All of these men possess a matching EXPENDABLES LOGO TATT

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: has a LASER DOT from his rifle centered on the LEADER’S CHEST, as BARNEY addresses the THIEF.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: There’s the money - Free the hostages. Unimpressed, the PIRATE LEADER looks at the LASER DOT on chest, then runs his fingers through the BEAM. He motions another PIRATE who retrieves the BAG. The LEADER looks inside.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (hard) How much in there?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Three million.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: You wait too long! Now it’s five!!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Last time - Free the hostages.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Five million!! Wired to the gills, GUNNAR barges forward roughly shoving YANG aside.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Move!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What the hell ya doin’? GUNNAR looks at Barney, eyes glazed. He raises his powerf RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: We want our money! Now!

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: - Warnin’ shot!!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No!! GUNNAR pulls the trigger sending a heavy grained bullet i center of the LEADER'S face. The film goes into SLOW MOTION. The PIRATE LEADER’S head completely gone. The stunned PIRATES stare in horror as t LEADER’S body still remains upright. The EXPENDABLES exch anxious looks. They know the scene is milliseconds away f chaos.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (simply) ..-Little low. With that the PIRATE LEADER’S body crumbles to a heap and battle is on! CHRISTMAS and HALE CAESAR toss TWO M-18 SMOKE GRENADES fr above and the Room is instantly enveloped into a billowin hell as the PIRATE’S gunfire ricochet everywhere. HOSTAGES duck against the wall seeking safety.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No firing till you’re down! CHRISTMAS and YANG leap over the side and rappel into the billowing SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (to Gunnar) Get the exit.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Who made you God? GUNNAR takes off as TOLL ROAD and BARNEY quickly rappel o the side into the thickening protective smoke. TWO PIRATES come charging up the stairs, out of the smoke HALE CAESAR appears at the top of the stairs, his shotgun leveled.

dialogues.speaker: BOOOM
dialogues.text: He blows both pirates into chop meat.  20

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 7
dialogues.text: Another PIRATE is fleeing up the steel steps and is blast back by HALE CAESAR. Through the fading HAZE of the grena smoke, HALE CAESAR moves into the BOWELS of the SHIP’S HO GUNNAR steps into view, his wild eyes craving the battle.

dialogues.speaker: YING YANG
dialogues.text: He leaps out from behind a CARGO STACK and catches a PIRA with a savage kick from his STEEL TIPPED BOOTS, then spra SECOND PIRATE with his MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATES
dialogues.text: In the shadowy ‘hold,’ the PIRATES are panicking and firi wildly. BULLETS ricochet off the SHIP’S STEEL SIDE with deafening reverberations. HALE CAESAR is hit in the PROTECTIVE VEST. He fires his S SHOTGUN and obliterates STACKS of CARGO that the assaulti PIRATE hides behind.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: leaps from cover and heaves a KNIFE at a PIRATE who is reloading, then fires his WEAPON three times at a PIRATE dives safely behind a CARGO STACK. The PIRATE now fires a BARNEY. TOLL ROAD suddenly appears behind the PIRATE and snaps his NECK.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY ROSS
dialogues.text: BARNEY ducks then spins out and with amazing economy he f off eight shots with his .45, hitting TWO ARMED PIRATES, then, speed loads and fires off SIX more at another PIRAT sprinting to an ambush location in less than 3 seconds. T PIRATE is blown off his feet.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: steps from his concealment and kicks one PIRATE with his STEEL TIPPED BOOTS and blows two more away as he rolls to safety.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: cuts down THREE PIRATES who fire from the top of CARGO STACKS. HALE CAESAR’S

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 8
dialogues.text: ferocious SHOTGUN blasts TWO MORE PIRATES ten feet back.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Without any regard for his own safety, he walks insanely forward as a pair of PIRATE’S BULLETS tear off the STACKE CARGO near his head. He blasts the PIRATE away with his H PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: is out of AMMO, but sees TWO PIRATES and with insane spee he whips out a pair of THROWING KNIVES and impales the thieves. A THIRD PIRATE tries to behead him from behind w a MACHETE. CHRISTMAS dodges the blow and crushes the man’ THROAT with a lethal blow.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: drops his empty WEAPON and whips out his MACHETE and anxiously moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: A STUDDED FIST slams into the PIRATE’S CHEST. The man attempts to raise the MACHETE, but TOLL ROAD grabs the ma behind his NECK, and crushes the PIRATE’S HEAD against hi STUDDED KNEE, and blows another PIRATE away with his REMINGTON MODEL 870 MCS ‘breach weapon.’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: swings around a CARGO STACK and catches TWO PIRATES broad with his .45. GUNNAR’S Drugged eyes are as wide as portholes as he snaps around corner and catches CHRISTMAS dead in his sights. Though t feet away, GUNNAR is aiming right between his teammate’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?! GUNNAR fires missing CHRISTMAS’ HEAD by an inch, but catc a PIRATE, who is taking aim twenty feet away. CHRISTMAS glares at GUNNAR and rapidly moves off.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (low) Crazy bastard! GUNNAR sees a PIRATE behind BARNEY and blows him away. Turning, he finds himself face to face with a LONG HAIRED PIRATE who shoots him point blank in the CHEST. GUNNAR recoils, then with incredible rage, fights the pain and w python-like speed, grabs the LONG HAIRED PIRATE by the throat.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Got ya!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Heaves another KNIFE at a PIRATE who runs between the CAR STACKS.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: sees ANOTHER PIRATE fleeing up the steps and fires twice. PIRATE tumbles down the stairs. SHIP’S HOLD From above we see the majority of the smoke has funneled

dialogues.speaker: PIRATES
dialogues.text: THREE PIRATES dash to a new location while shooting wildl BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: suddenly leaps into view, kicking one in the gut, the oth across the jaw, and plugs the third with his PISTOL.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: His thick hand lashes out and seizes a PIRATE by the thro who is firing at CHRISTMAS. He heaves him forward, back h another PIRATE with is SHOTGUN then fires his weapon at another PIRATE who ducks to safety.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: approaches from the opposite direction and drives his ELB squarely into his FOREHEAD, then pulling out a huge dagge like KNIFE aptly called ‘The Arkansas Toothpick,’ parries another PIRATE’S MACHETE and with a stupendous elbow to t forehead, crushes him to the SHIP’S FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Clearing his way around the CARGO, he sees EIGHT PIRATES snatch up the BOUND HOSTAGES, using them as a shield. A v tall PIRATE has one of the hostages by the hair, a KNIFE his throat.

dialogues.speaker: TALL PIRATE
dialogues.text: (insanely) We kill them! We kill them! BARNEY sees what CHRISTMAS sees. HALE CAESAR drifts into and blocking the steps, likewise TOLL ROAD, YANG joins in from the opposite angle. They are all blocking the stairw EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: TALL PIRATE
dialogues.text: Drop the weapons! The PIRATES have weapons pointed at the HOSTAGES’ heads. MERCENARIES look toward BARNEY, who remains stone faced.

dialogues.speaker: TALL PIRATE
dialogues.text: We kill them all! I don’t care! BARNEY lowers his PISTOLS to the ground, likewise the TWO OTHER MEN. While rising, he glances at CHRISTMAS, who has also lowered his COMPACT RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Got the four on the left.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (secretly to Christmas) Take the two on the right, I got the rest. CHRISTMAS never removes his eyes from the PIRATE LEADER.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (low) ...You’re not that fast anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Only thing faster is light.

dialogues.speaker: PIRATE
dialogues.text: Bring the money here now! The MONEY rests near HALE CAESAR. He eyes BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (eyeing the pirate) ...-Boomlay, boom. A fellow pirate starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: TALL PIRATE
dialogues.text: (in Somalian) Kill them - Like a blur BARNEY quick-draws a custom built SIX SHOOTER from the small of his back as CHRISTMAS’ whips out TWO THROWING KNIVES hidden behind his shoulders with blinding speed, then whips out TWO MORE fastened to either side of leg. It’s hard to tell which is faster, BARNEY’S BULLETS CHRISTMAS’ KNIVES, but EIGHT DEAD PIRATES hit the ground. Stone-faced BARNEY moves forward and begins cutting the HOSTAGES loose.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (teasingly) Call it a tie.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: (to Christmas and Barney) Call it narcissistic.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: This place smells, let’s go! ONE HOSTAGE begins to profusely thank BARNEY. BARNEY'S unimpressed. CHRISTMAS’ attention is drawn upward.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doin’?! Overhead is GUNNAR, wrapping the repelling rope around th semi-conscious LONG HAIRED PIRATE’S neck.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Whatta ya doin’?

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: I’m killin’ killers!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let ‘im go!

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (to Gunnar) This is no good. (sprints away) EXT. SHIP’S HOLD GUNNAR continues to wrap the repelling rope around the LO HAIRED PIRATE’S neck.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (tying the knot) You hang pirates! GUNNAR yanks the PIRATE upright and turns him face forwar like a man on a gallows.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: They’d do it to us!!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Put one in his leg. BARNEY takes aim as GUNNAR prepares to shove the PIRATE o the CARGO HOLD LEDGE when he is blind-sided by a arcing K from YANG that staggers him sideways. GUNNAR and YANG YANG squares off against GUNNAR, who’s eyes fill with rag he charges YANG.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: observe what just transpired and rush toward the staircas

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Attacks YANG who lands a crushing KICK to the knee and a to the eye that splits the big man’s BROW open. With startling speed, GUNNAR parries YANG’S next blow, th seizing him by the throat, smashes him to the ground. Instantly there’s a HUGE BOWIE KNIFE pressed against YANG throat. BLOOD streams along the side of GUNNAR’S face.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (hard) You’re on my team?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: We don’t kill like that.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: I do. GUNNAR tips the shiny blade and studies his distorted reflection. A PISTOL is jammed against the back of his he He sees BARNEY in the reflection.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Back off. GUNNAR holds fast, never taking his eyes off YANG.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Bastard kicked me.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Think I‘1l need stitches.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah - Let ‘im go.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (low) Sure, after I pull out his throat. Suddenly YANG slams a knee into GUNNAR’S GROIN and sweeps razor sharp BLADE away from his throat, then leaps to his feet. GUNNAR prepares to likewise leap up, only to find BARNEY jamming a PISTOL BARREL against his forehead. YANG moves attack, but is stopped by HALE CAESAR.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: We don’t kill people who can’t fight back!

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (out of it) Bad karma is it? CHRISTMAS reaches into GUNNAR’S pocket and pulls out a SM PLASTIC CELLOPHANE POUCH of METH and smells it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Meth. (to Barney) Tenth time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY takes the METH BAG from CHRISTMAS as GUNNAR rises.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Bad habit.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Very bad, Brother.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Who's perfect? * He looks over to Barney, whose face registers the pain of compassion stretched too far for too long.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Give Christmas the knife - Do it. GUNNAR stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ...Jdust for a while. * Reluctantly GUNNAR hangs over the massive weapon.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: -..One of a kind. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Gunnar, you’re done with us. GUNNAR looks defeated, confused. He looks at the other EXPENDABLES for support.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Done?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’re no good to us anymore.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (hard) That right?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You got skills. There’s always gonna be somethin’ out there.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (to Barney) No more chances? *  34 35

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: You’ve had many chances. Gunnar turns to Barney, rage and hurt mingling in his twe out face.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Fifteen years. (to Toll Road) Cuff me before I kill somebody. I mean it - Do it - Barney nods. TOLL ROAD fastens a PAIR of PLASTIC CUFFS ar GUNNAR’S wrists.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Sorry, Brother. At this moment the LONG HAIRED PIRATE begins to regain consciousness and weakly removes the ROPE from around his neck. GUNNAR kicks out his LEG catching the degenerate PIRATE flush, thus sending him over the edge of the CARGO HOLD. CHRISTMAS moves with unbelievable speed, and taking GUNNA BOWIE KNIFE, slashes the rope around the falling PIRATE’S neck in half before it snaps taunt. The PIRATE crashes unconsciously on a STACK OF CARGO.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: .+.They would've done it to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney’s sea plane cruises through the starlit sky. INT. BARNEY’S SEA PLANE - NIGHT (CREDIT SEQUENCE) The EXPENDABLES are all in their own space. Barney is at controls, stares straight ahead. CHRISTMAS sits in the co pilot seat. YANG sits deep in meditation. HALE CAESAR rea book. TOLL ROAD, wearing GLASSES, reads a self help BOOK. GUNNAR sits in the rear with his hands bound. CHRISTMAS r and gives GUNNAR water, then cuts him loose. CHRISTMAS th hands him his huge KNIFE and SHEATH.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Keep it - You appreciate a good blade.  36

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 16
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS nods and moves away. GUNNAR’S head slumps into hands. EXT. LACY’S HOME - NIGHT CHRISTMAS arrives on a DUCATI MOTORCYCLE. He removes a bo of CHAMPAGNE from inside his jacket, but pauses when he s a tricked out RANGE ROVER in the driveway and starts up t stairs. EXT. LACY’S HOME - NIGHT CHRISTMAS moves up the steps to the porch, flicks a famil WIND CHIME, then tries to open the SCREEN DOOR. It’s lock He rings the bell, and the outline of a woman appears on other side of a frosted glass door.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ‘,..Someday you’1l find a man who will be happy just to watch you sleep.’ There’s an unsettling pause on the other side of the door

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Lee?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Who else? The frosted door opens a crack and LACY appears. She’s in early 30's. She’s a good soul, attractive in a very natur way. She unlocks the SCREEN DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (low) I didn’t know you were back.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Just arrived - Who’s truck’s that?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) ..-A neighbor's. They asked if they could park there. He goes to gently kiss her, and she slightly averts her l

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (anxiously) I wish you would’ve called.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah, I’ve never been a good caller.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: I haven't heard from you in over a month.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (awkward) Really? Won’t happen again. LACY nods ‘yes.’

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Look what I found. He holds up the CHAMPAGNE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (jokingly) Rose flavored - (smiles) It’s a nice porch, but I’d rather be inside.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lace? CHRISTMAS stiffens and leans into the doorway. In the background, PAUL, a physically strong, mid 30’s, c cut MAN steps into view wearing long pants and a white T- shirt. Aggressive jock written all over him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: ..-Everything alright? Who’re you?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (low) He’s a friend. The word ‘friend’ sinks Lee’s heart.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What’s up? He locks eyes with CHRISTMAS. For a man who is a natural fighting machine, the fight seems to drain from his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against the railing, he gently places the BOTTLE CHAMPAGNE on the ground...

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Kinda late - Your name is what?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) What’s it matter - PAUL tenses and starts to drift forward.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Got a problem?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Please, give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Yeah, a minute. PAUL reluctantly backs away. LACY steps outside and stand directly behind the crestfallen man.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to himself) Friend...

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (deflated) I thought things were good between us.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Maybe for you, but not for me - You never really cared about getting into my life or really letting me into yours.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - Sure I did.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: No, not the way people who are serious about each other do - I’ve known you for over a year - I don’t even know what you do for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brings feels she’ He drifts out. PAUL CHRISTMAS’ composure.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: When I’m here, I’m with you, when I’m not, I’m thinking about you - What more do you need?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: When you’re here, you’re not really. You don’t open up - Tell me what you’re feeling - You're a good person, you are, but I need to make a life for myself.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lace. a RING BOX from behind his back. LACY deflates. She s being pulled between emotional force fields.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: For you, a ruby from Burma - It’s a good color, but it’s hard to see that in this light. toward the open door and the light that streams is standing way in the background.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: How ‘bout it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I hate his voice - (the ring) Take it - Show it to him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: How ‘bout it, Lace?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: I should go - jaws clench as he struggles to maintain his

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Go - I don’t wanna see you get hurt - Anybody hurt. PAUL starts to move forward. CHRISTMAS sees PAUL starting approach.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Don’t let him come out here. Really. Do not. + eH

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (facing PAUL) Please, just...a second. She gestures to PAUL with her hands. He reluctantly pause

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: ..-.-Lee, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Tell him to go - He’s no good.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (still in the background) ..-You say something?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (sadly) Why couldn’t you be like this before? She meekly retreats and closes the door. With his gut in knots, CHRISTMAS closes the RING BOX and walks from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TATTOO NEEDLE APPLYING INK TO A SHOULDER. The retro mus leaks from a small CD machine.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO
dialogues.text: INT. TOOL’S TATTOO PARLOR - NIGHT BARNEY sits in a CLASSIC OLD SCHOOL TATTOO PARLOR. There TWO OTHER VACANT STATIONS. He studies the OLD TATTOO PRIN on the wall and eyes several PHOTOGRAPHS of himself taken year earlier in Special Forces combat fatigues, standing to TOOL in some exotic hellhole. The cavernous sound of an approaching MOTORCYCLE intensif As BARNEY turns toward the rumbling, we see the glowing HEADLIGHTS of a HARLEY MOTORCYCLE. The PLAIN LOOKING CHOP enters through a METAL DOOR, gliding through dim light. I travels towards BARNEY, finally pausing near a small FREI ELEVATOR. Stepping off the bike is TOOL and an attractive FEMALE COMPANION. The room is full of BEAUTIFULLY DESIGNE MOTORCYCLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOOL’S body is completely covered in INK IMAGES. He is dressed i LEATHER PANTS, LEATHER VEST while an abundance of SILVER JEWELRY hangs from his wrists. A EXPENDABLE TATTOO is on FOREARM.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: ‘Mr. Machine;’ what’s shakin’? Givin’ up sleepin’? Say hello to Apache.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Cheyenne -

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Sorry Darlin,’ knew it sounded like some Reservation. TOOL gives BARNEY a respectful hug.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Brother. He slips on a pair of RUBBER GLOVES. The GIRL heads towar the FREIGHT ELEVATOR.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Cheyenne, fix me up with a martini, six olives and one of them skinny Tennessee cigars, if you would - (to Barney) Says she loves me.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: An’ you believe it.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Hey, I believed the last fifty.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Ya build all these beautiful bikes and ride that beast?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: I’m a confused artist.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (gesturing to the bikes) Been too long since we've taken a run up the coast on ‘em. That was good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY nods and removes his shirt showing extensive TATTO especially a RAVEN sitting on a SKULL located in the cent of his BACK. TOOL stares down at the TATTOO. The word ‘EXPENDABLE’ only goes to the letter '‘D.’

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: We gonna finally finish this thing? Hell, it’s taken over ten girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Some chumps use a calendar, I use emotional breakups. TOOL prepares the INK in a small CUP.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We dropped Gunnar.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: When a dude goes Crankenstein, gotta cut ‘im loose.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: He had my back fifty times, we been through it, then when he’s hurting, and when I cut ‘im loose, didn’t feel anythin.’

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Lifestyle gettin’ to ya.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, how ‘bout fillin’ in?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Man, I’ve got no ‘fillin’ in’ desire since we were layin’ in that Nigerian mud, you holdin’ a shot up hand and me leakin’ from two holes in my lovely chest - Swore right then if I’m gonna die, it’s gonna be for a woman or over a woman or by a woman. TOOL lowers the TATTOO NEEDLE onto the incomplete ‘EXPENDABLE’ name. Just then ANOTHER MOTORCYCLE is heard CHRISTMAS enters through the same door as TOOL guides his BIKE near the TATTOO BOOTH. CHRISTMAS enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH +e * HF  %

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: The ‘Christmas’ man - How ya doin,’ Friend? CHRISTMAS cuts the ENGINE, but remains strattling his BIK

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Good, Tool, very good.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: How’s the Misses?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, good - Emotional - It’s how they get, isn’t it. But, yeah, it’s all good. BARNEY senses something’s amiss. He gestures to CHRISTMAS who just wearily shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (to Barney) All done, Darkness. TOOL rises and gestures toward the RAVEN TATTOO lettering

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Whatta ya think?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Still looks like a dark chicken.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: ‘The letterin’, Sad Eyes. How ‘bout some new ink for you?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’s ‘sad eyes’ mean? TOOL continues to tattoo BARNEY while adjusting MAGNIFYIN GLASSES he pulls down from his FOREHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: So, Knifeman, how ‘bout somethin’ cheerful across that muscular forehead, like a drawing of Charlotte’s Web and then perhaps a shy Charlotte peering out of your ear, capturing all them doubt bugs floatin’ around in your mind, preventin’ anything obtrusive or abusive coming out of that head of yours - That’s what you need, Christmas. More MYSTERY, and a little less CHARACTER, then afterward, we'll go down to the river and have a mint julep, and look at the chickies, or if you prefer, a Frappucino. Make sense?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (cooly) If you're retarded, yeah. TOOL rises and removes a LARGE KNIFE and snaps it open.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Y'know, I’m feelin’ very accurate this evenin,’ Knifeman - Ten bucks.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Nah, maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: No big disgrace to lose.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’ve lost the last twenty times.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Been settin’ him up - Ten bucks, Sadness.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’s with this ‘Sadness’ shit?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) I‘ll pay, it’s worth it to shut him out. Without any enthusiasm, CHRISTMAS snaps open his FOLDING KNIFE. He throws first and hits a target that is HITLER’S FACE. His KNIFE lands just off the side of the EAR. 24

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (mockingly) Inspirin’, inspirational, intimidatin’. + eH With unexpected speed, TOOL heaves his KNIFE that buries itself in the center of HITLER’S face.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Expect to win, ya win, Brother. * CHRISTMAS puts on a brave face, but he is embarrassed. * The PHONE rings. TOOL answers as CHRISTMAS hands over a T DOLLAR BILL.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Who died?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (into phone) I’m listening - Alright, later. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Three bits - Two on the east coast, decent bread - The other, ‘To Hell and Back,’ shit.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I need some down time. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Make a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the modest exterior of a non-denominational CHURCH the center of the city. BARNEY’S TRUCK is parked on the s of the structure.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can call me Mr. Church - It’s not my real name.  38

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 26
dialogues.text: INT. — CHURCH - DAY Sitting in the PEW is a man known only as CHURCH. He is a business. Hard in mind and soul. Fear and subtly is alien this individual. His eyes belong in the skull of a predat

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: But you don’t need to know my real name, just like I don’t need or want to know your real name.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Then what do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: That you can deliver. Have you ever heard of Vilena?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: A dirt patch of an island in the Gulf. There are certain resources on Vilena - The interests I represent want to invest a large sum of money on this island. Following this?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (tense) You look bored.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It’s my bone structure.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (removes his sunglasses) Let’s take off our glasses.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: It’s more honest - You know what I mean. CHURCH’S eyes bore into BARNEY’S trying to get a read on where he’s coming from.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Much better - The President of the country, General Ruben Garza, overthrew the government and for the past year or so, his death squads have decimated the population - He even had two of our company’s soil researchers killed, we're told he was in on the execution. He hands a PICTURE over from a FOLDER. BARNEY studies the PHOTO. This one of a tin pot despot of man, in an over medaled uniform, his eyes hold the hint o madness.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (pushing the drama) That’s Garza. His so-called ‘Red Guards’ kill unarmed woman and children without thinking twice.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (unaffected) ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: You have any children? Mr. Ross?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: I relate.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I got a truck and a seaplane.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Right - Anyway, the majority of the people go hungry while -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Wait -

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let me stop you, what people eat isn’t my concern, what they pay is.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: No foreplay here. (tensing) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHURCH (cont'd) The people I represent won’t do business with a government that could collapse in a few years or one that could become more radical. CHURCH stares straight into BARNEY’S eyes. He hands over FOLDER.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: More details - And we have arranged a contact - A well financed mercenary operation could succeed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’re wasting my time. What d’you want?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (barely holding it together) I don’t like your attitude.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Makes two of us. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Garza permanently removed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Furniture’s removed - Be specific.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (hardens ) We want him gone -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - Dead?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Yes, dead. His soldiers dead. His half-assed government, dead. Specific enough?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: How many outfits did you ask before you got around to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4l 4lA

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Ten? Twenty?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: What’s it matter?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Must be gettin’ desperate.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: This your way of starting negotiations? Barney heads back to his truck. Once inside, he takes out MINIATURE VIDEO CAMERA and withdrawing the MEMORY CHIP, p it into the PC on the seat beside him. Hitting the play button, he studies the CLOSE-UP FOOTAGE of CHURCH request he attack the island of VILENA. Having seen enough, he cl the LAPTOP and the scene goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PALACE is old and solid, and has a forboding aura. La LIGHTS shine down from the BARBED WIRED walls that surrou this horrible structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL GARZA, a hefty paranoid, with a volatile personal stares at a beautiful POOL that lies below him.

dialogues.speaker: RED BERET
dialogues.text: General!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARZA, still in his bathrobe, comes striding through the dimly lit, EERIE TUNNELS, followed by his ELITE GUARDS. O either side in small cave like cells, peasant workers are engaged in unloading WHITE POWDER bricks and placing them stacks on wooden pallets. GARZA comes upon more of his guards surrounding a trembli PEASANT WORKER and his exhausted, small, mid-thirties WIF and 15 YR OLD SON. One of the guards holds a SMALL PLASTI BAG of the white powder, which he hands to GARZA, who reg it calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHOTOGRAPHER snaps off a steady stream of STILL SHOTS Garza comes face to face with the terror stricken peasant All dialogue is in SPANISH.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: (calmly in Spanish) Did you steal from me?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: No. Please Excellency. I would never steal from you! Never!

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Everything that comes out of the ground is not yours, it’s mine. You know that, yes?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: I swear on the lives of my children!

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I understand, but if I can’t see inside of you - How do I know if you’re telling the truth? And then, suddenly....

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: From out of the darkness comes a bone jarring explosion t causes ALL present to jump out of their skins. From the shadows emerges an American, JAMES MONROE, a rou CIA Officer in his 40’s. His hair is slicked back, his demeanor calm, but in his eyes the blackness that inspire fear. Backing him up are three lethal looking Americans, Blackwater types. PAINE, and his TWO EX-AMERICAN OPERATIV In Monroe’s hand, a Desert Eagle, smoke still curling fro the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Now you can see ‘inside him,’ and I see lies. Garza, looks from the dead man to Monroe, annoyed. MONROE moves off followed by PAINE and the TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES. The loyal RED BERET GUARDS stare hard at the departing AMERICAN.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (dismissive) .--And he wasn’t stealing from you, he was stealing from us both. Garza looks after them, rattled, frustrated, has a hard t meeting his own private guard’s dour expression.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) When you want them gone, General?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (eyeing the body) Take care of this. He moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS drive through the city.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (low) I dunno - I don’t like washing my laundry in front of people.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I understand. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I had this good thing going. (shrugs ) A good thing, and it turned bad. Why do I always mess things up?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: People change.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: No, it’s not her, it’s me, I'm never there when I should be.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You're never there because you're insecure.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Be serious.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You can’t take being rejected.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You don’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No, you do.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You know, what I should do - Just dial back, y’know, be on my own awhile. (lost in thought) I think a guy who probably gets along best with women, is a guy who can get along without ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY glances at him, feels his angst.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: If it makes you feel any better, I’m insecure too.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (smiles) You've got a black heart.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s her loss. CHRISTMAS looks out the window thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: This new job - It sounds bad.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: But the money could be good.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to the code we started out with -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Which code? 32

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: C'mon, you know, no matter what the money, the target has to deserve it. EXT TOOL’S - EARLY EVENING BARNEY pulls the TRUCK to the curb in front of TOOL’S.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Forget code. For cash we remove those hard to get at stains, and the more I see, the more I think both sides usually deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (exiting) I’m not buyin’ into that.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Stick around. CHRISTMAS closes the door and enters TOOL’S SOCIAL CLUB. BARNEY picks up the FOLDER that CHURCH gave him, begins t look through the pictures. He comes to a GOOGLE MAP OF AN ISLAND, and it’s SEAPORT. He is so deeply in thought he d not hear anything behind him, until...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Vilena? Barney shuts the folder quickly, turns to...

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Next job? BARNEY exits the truck.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (distantly) They got work there?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t be here, Gunnar.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Don’t replace me - I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You're sick, can’t trust a man like that. + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (hard) We were friends.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I was the ‘other’ guy’s friend. And with a final look of hurt, GUNNAR heads away.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (low) Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Threatenin’ me?

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) ...No, the ‘other’ guy. BARNEY watches as he disappears around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: 44 INT. TOOL’S METAL SHOP - DUSK The camera pans down from a large EXPENDABLE LOGO painted the shop wall. The large space is crammed with an array of MACHINERY. SECTIONS of SEAPLANE, such as half of it’s FUSELAGE, are suspended from the ceiling while several METAL PROPELLERS fastened to the wall. The area is a perfect blending of t Dark Age meets the Industrial Age. BARNEY is tooling with large AIRPLANE ENGINE as the other EXPENDABLES CHRISTMAS, HALE CAESAR, YANG and TOLL ROAD lounge around the HEAVY D MACHINERY.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: He said something like the population of this island is around five or six thousand, no more.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) How many soldiers?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: How would I know?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Maybe couple a hundred.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Wouldn’t take much more to control a place like that and they’re most likely not well trained.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: You don’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: (offended) No, I don’t, I surmise.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Sounds on the crazy side. HALE CAESAR dips his SPOON into a take out CUP of GUMBO.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s not as crazy as it looks.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: No, to a crazy person it wouldn’t - Man, they got a small army, we only got three and a half men. (indicating Yang)

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (offended) Go dance some place.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Caesar, don’t wind him up.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Your food smells bad - Disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Fresh chicken gumbo’s disgustin’, but chowin’ down rats an’ the brain of a monkey isn’t?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: He swore off monkey - Too expensive. (to Yang) Hey, if the smell’s botherin’ you, then throw it under the table - somethin’ down there will eat it. + eH *

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (ignores them) Not so funny - (to Barney) I would like a raise.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: I need more money for my son - I want to send him to a better school and buy my wife a new home.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Wait up! When did Ying Yang get a ‘family?’

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: You don’t ask before, I don’t tell. (to Barney) I’ve meditated on this, I want my family to be secure. I want to be a iver, not a taker. I want a raise before we die.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Nobody’s dying.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: It will happen.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I hate when he takes that crap out of his demented brain and tries to put it into ours! - Yang, you’re the ‘kick the guy in the head’ guy, not the ‘bad karma’ guy.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Yang) Family or not, everybody gets equal shares. The target in Vilena is a General Garza, who’s regime is presenting problems.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: What’s it matter?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (dryly) I can’t ask?

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Their problems shouldn’t matter ‘cause we have our own set of problems and either you get rid of them first, or they get rid of you.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: See your shrink lately?

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: (nods ) This mornin.’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What you talk about?

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Ah, A.P.D. - Avoidant Personality Disorder. (they all stare)

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Social inhibitions, low self worth, sensitivity to criticism and so on.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: You think too much.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: That’s how you get better.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Everybody's got problems, Toll Road. You’re an unusual guy, with an unusual job. Problems never go away.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: When you say unusual? Meaning my ear?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s focus on the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Just a minute - We all know I wrestled in college, and certain injuries related to that sport, can cause trauma to the ear, such as a clot and if left unattended, the cartilage contracts forming what is known as a ‘Cauliflower ear.’

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Movin’ on, Toll Road.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Not yet - I had this good friend, my roommate, who would bring up my ‘ear configuration’ all the time at parties, special events, name it. But I didn’t mind ‘cause my friend and roommate would brag about my unusual ear calling it a ‘badge of courage,’ so I felt less self conscious hearing these compliments and that pleased me, but that pleasure was short lived -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - Where’s this goin’, Toll Road?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - Into a pit of madness -

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: I listen to you birds - You listen to me - One mornin,’ before spring break, I overheard my roommate on the phone, makin’ comments about my quote ‘queer ear, ‘meat biscuit,’ ‘face bubble,’ an’ so on, meanin’ I’d become a gag piece simply because I looked ‘different.’ So to educate my roommate on common decency that should be afforded to anyone who appears ‘different,’ I smashed the right side of his head several times until he had a permanent cluster of cauliflower of his own. EVERYONE stares in stunned silence as they all look at TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e % + eH

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (sighs) Nie bit of history - Anyway, me an’ Christmas will be headin’ to Vilena to see what’s what an’ if a workable strategy is possible. All the men nod.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: How much it pay? BARNEY flips open his phone.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: He’s gonna find that out right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see CHURCH in the rear. TWO OTHER AGENTS ride up front

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Speak.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We're going to Vilena - Let’s settle on a price up front.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Five million. The OTHER EXPENDABLES almost swallow their tongues. They exchange surprised expressions.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Get serious.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Get five.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Math isn’t your strong suit, Barney.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No. + eH

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Two. TOOL’S MACHINE SHOP Cut back to BARNEY and company.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Transfer half into an offshore account, I'll give you the number later.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: You got square balls.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Haven't checked lately. CHURCH hangs up. BARNEY faces his MEN who smile broadly.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) ...-Let’s travel.

dialogues.speaker: OF THE ISLAND OF VILENA.
dialogues.text: In the background are Vilena’s formative mountains that a lush with dense foliage. A large GRUMMAN UF-26 ALBATROSS SEAPLANE swoops into view OCEAN SPRAY arcs beside the plane’s large PONTOONS as it powers down.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I hate this hat.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...Then take it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A near dilapidated CUSTOM’S OFFICE comes into view as BARNEY'S SEAPLANE rumbles into view. He cuts the engines.  52 53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY adjusts the controls, as CHRISTMAS eyes the bleak surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ..-Now I know where to retire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS stand in front of a sunken-eyed CUST AGENT. On the wall is a LARGE PHOTO of GENERAL GARZA. Nea TWO RAWBONED SOLDIERS lounge in a pair of worn CHAIRS. A CEILING FAN overhead is barely spinning at two revolution per minute. An UNSHAVEN CUSTOMS AGENT eyes the CLOSE-UP of the men’s PASSPORTS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: How are you? You speak English? The AGENT nods smugly and looks at the SOLDIERS then look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Big plane.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We transport a lot of injured animals.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (heavy accent) Why you here? BARNEY hands over a BUSINESS CARD.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We’re on assignment. We're photographing exotic birds and such.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We're Ornithologists. The agent doesn’t quite understand. CHRISTMAS holds up a NATURE MAGAZINE with EXOTIC BIRDS on cover. BARNEY hands over his credentials.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Birdmen?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You could call it that.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (tauntingly) ..-Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Nervous? Why?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: You just look nervous.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Do I look nervous?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (smiles) No, just a little stressed.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Long flight.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. The AGENT finishes toying with them, then stamps their passports.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (handing back the passports) Good luck Birdman, there’s not many birds here.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: No, we eat most of them. The AGENT winks at the GUARDS as if he’s proud of tauntin the Americans. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS move off. THE ACTION TURNS TO SKIP F as a security camera hidden in the clock overhead takes t pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS wander the streets of the main city. Loud HONKING draws their attention. TWO MILITARY JEEPS followed by an open back MILITARY TRUCK crammed with 20 H CORE SOLDIERS rumble along the narrow main street. These SOLDIERS wear the DARK RED BERETS signifying that they ar part of GARZA’S BRUTAL ELITE TROOPS. The country’s new FLAG (an image of GENERAL GARZA) flies the corners of the hoods of all the vehicles. Though slig obscured, we see BARNEY and CHRISTMAS pass into view. The depressed, intimidated LOCALS listlessly move aside a the CONVOY approaches. THE TWO ARMY JEEPS begin blasting their horns. People mov aside. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS observe FOUR AMERICAN OPERATIVES, dressed in khaki as they pass into view in the LEAD JEEP. They then observe the SECOND JEEP in which PAINE is drivi and riding shotgun is MONROE with his slicked back hair a pair of aviator glasses, who exudes power, and menace. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS eye the men as they pass directly in front of their observation point. Christmas starts filmin them with a converted still camera.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Got ‘em?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: No, I’m on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLD MAN struggles to push a RICKETY CART full of junk of the way. He passes in front of the TROOP TRUCK. HORNS blare. The OLD MAN stands petrified. This disrespect is n tolerated.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 44
dialogues.text: The TROOPS leap from the LEAD JEEP and berate the OLD MAN PAINE steps from the deep. He is wearing a conspicuous SHOULDER HOLSTER. In his thick hand is an equally thick, short, BLACK CLUB attached to a LEATHER STRAP. PAINE motions to the SOLDIERS who commence to shoving peo aside, then SMASHING the OLD MAN’S cart. MONROE coolly lo on. SOLDIERS RE-BOARD the TRANSPORT TRUCK. The LOCALS share i the man’s pain, but are terrified to show any outward emotion. PAINE starts to climb back in his JEEP. An OLDER WOMAN suddenly starts to yell curses at the TROO TRUCK. The SOLDIERS rush forward and commence to roughing up. SERGEANT OF THE GUARD grabs her and flings her agains the wall, curses her nose to nose. MONROE gestures to PAI

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Let's go! The SOLDIERS load up and they are gone. BARNEY and CHRIST also move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS ascend the inclined cobblestone alle and pause before a RUNDOWN CANTINA. BARNEY checks the address, then proceeds to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The impoverished establishment is furnished solely with t small hand hewn tables and a makeshift ‘bar’ fashioned crudely from bits of LUMBER and recycled corrugated STEEL PANELS. An OLD WOMAN BARTENDER sits idly on a stool. CHRISTMAS and BARNEY enter the dismal CANTINA, and scan t empty room. BARNEY checks his WATCH as they move to the b

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: They’re late. The OLD LADY asks if they want a drink.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: No, gracias - CHRISTMAS looks down at a half full BOWL of NUTS. A ROACH scampers out.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: One of the nuts just walked away - Where’s the contact?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I hate hats -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Take it off - BARNEY irritably tosses his HAT to the table. At this very moment we see a SINGLE INDIVIDUAL enter the cantina. Because of the near non-existent interior light, coupled by the glare from outside, it is hard to make out stranger’s features.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (removing the hat) That’s the contact?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Could be.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Too bad she’s so homely.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Stay focused. Stepping forward is SANDRA (20’s.) She’s very attractive natural way. Her dark intense eyes fix on the TWO AMERICA BARNEY is taken by her profound physical presence. SANDRA warily approaches, visibly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (latin accent) I am Sandra - What are your names?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ...Buddha and Pest.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Follow me, please. And without another word, she heads for the rear door of cantina.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ‘Buddha and Pest...’

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Relax.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 46
dialogues.text: Barney says nothing, gives Christmas a look like what the hell. EXT. GARZA’S PALACE WIDE SHOT of the COMPOUND. INT. GARZA’S CHAMBERS Extreme CLOSE UP of a smear of COLOR being spread across WHITE CANVAS. GARZA sits at an EASEL near the balcony painting a PORTRAIT OF HIMSELF. The image is disturbing a the majority of his face is a void as if to indicate his is hollow. The DOOR opens and MONROE enters followed by PAINE. THREE loyal RED BERET GUARDS glare at them.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Morning, General. (dryly) Let’s take a ride.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: When I finish.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: That’d be now. MONROE exits.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (to staring guards) ...See something. With thinly concealed disdain, the GUARDS turn away as PA also exits. GARZA can not match the gaze of his frustrate SOLDIERS as he passes. EXT. SANDRA’S PICK UP TRUCK - DAY Dust kicks up from the partially paved road as SANDRA dri her terribly rundown mini PICKUP TRUCK towards the outski of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the visor are SIX SMALL SKILLFULLY SKETCHED PORTRAITS local women. One in particular stands out. A WOMAN’S WING PORTRAIT.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: How long you stay?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: One day.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Come and go, just like all the * rest. * SANDRA sees BARNEY eyeing her ARTWORK.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...You do these?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes - Take one - a gift.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I don’t take free gifts - How much * do you want? *

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Takin’ money for * somethin’s not a gift. * SANDRA pulls it down and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Takin’ nothin’ for somethin’ is - * Reluctantly, Barney takes the WINGED WOMAN’S HEAD from SA and puts it in his pocket. 66 INT. SANDRA’S PICK UP TRUCK - DAY SANDRA drives while BARNEY sits in the middle and CHRISTM rides shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: So what’re you doing here? *

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Studying birds.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, studying birds that know how to survive, they sense when things are gonna change and just fly away. BARNEY glances at him like he’s lost his mind.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So how close can you get to the palace?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: To see the view.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: There’s no view.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Like to see it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monroe stares at an unplanted field, with peasants lazily turning the soil. His mood is black. He turns to Garza. W is uncomfortable. Paine, and OPERATIVE #2 AND #3 stand of the side, eyeing several of Garza’s Red Berets.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Where’s the growth? Where’s the manpower?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: People are getting weak.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Do you know how long it takes a coca plant to produce? Two months “ago!” We’re eight weeks behind schedule. Kick your peasants’ asses, I need my product!

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: When you talk this way to me in front of my men - It’s not good. MONROE closes to within inches of GARZA’S face.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (quietly) You're right, it’s embarrassing - Listen closely - I am the life line. I am the coordinator of all this confusion. I’m making you rich. Through my network, my contacts, and being wealthy is very good because it allows people to be the real ‘ass wipes’ nature intended them to be - No more faking it, but if you want me gone, shoot me, if you want ongoing wealth, grow thicker skin and get me my product. The fire in Monroe’s eyes burns into Garza.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (hard) This is not worth the money. MONROE smiles, backs off.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Sure it is. He stalks off, with his men following. Garza takes a deep breath, tries to regain his composure.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSKIRTS OF TOWN
dialogues.text: BARNEY, CHRISTMAS and SANDRA ride in SANDRA’S MINI-PICKUP TRUCK. They rock uncomfortably down a pot-holed road. The extreme poverty affects BARNEY. A group of SOLDIERS in RED BERETS have pinned several YOU MEN against a wall. They are being roughly interrogated, shoved into MILITARY TRUCKS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It like this all the time? BARNEY looks out the window as their VEHICLE passes filth bare footed CHILDREN carrying BUCKETS of brackish water a joyless adults clad in near thread bare RAGS slump agains crumbling HOUSE/SHACKS.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (dryly) Yes, all the time. This place, this place you see now - was a beautiful place. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDRA (cont'd) Then one day, they came with money and General Garza sells his soul, now you have a dying place.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You said ‘came with money.’ Who?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Some Americans - That’s all I know - But all this will change back.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You believe that? *

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes, and the best day of our lives * will be the one when we can say our * lives are going to be our own * again. *

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Nice thought. * BARNEY studies her committed expression.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You have family?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: My mother died long ago - My father - He died too - You have family?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: He has a truck an’ a seaplane.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: If I were you I’d think about leavin’.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Why? It’s my country.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Look around.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You said it was dyin’. *

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: But it’s not dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDRA'S mood darkens.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Gettin’ kinda bleak. (to Sandra) Sometimes trying to be helpful, comes out wrong. Sandra, I was wonderin’ about somethin’ from, say, a female point of view. SANDRA does not understand.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Conversing - Look it up.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Be focused.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Be flexible. (to Sandra) Outta curiosity, ever have a person you, ah, say liked, or more, ask you to like get lost?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Get lost?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Y'know, go away, leave, not be with ‘em anymore.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Focus.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Chill - (to Sandra) Did it make you feel bad about yourself?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Bad...Yes. BARNEY shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: But we’re not bad people -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: A little dignity.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Please - (to Sandra) Makes you wonder, is it us or them who’s messed up? I mean could a bad person ever say something like: ‘Tienes que encontrar un hombre que siempre se quedara despierto solo para verte dormir.’

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (touched) That’s nice.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What'd Little Boy Blue say?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: ‘Someday I will find a man who will be happy just to watch me sleep.’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Hopeless? ‘Cause I’m trying to connect with people’ - Try it sometime - I mean, why the hell are we in this world anyway! Look who I’m talkin’ to. (to Sandra) We close?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: It’s just over there.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Pull over, please. SANDRA pulls over and CHRISTMAS steps out.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Nothin’, we just like to look at the view from different angles. (he leans in to Barney) You have a black heart. He moves off.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Cry baby. CHRISTMAS turns and angrily throws his hat then moves off

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let’s keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and SANDRA stand beside a BERM along the barely discernible dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Why’re you looking here? BARNEY walks off the road and looks at the PALACE in the distance. SANDRA is extremely uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Who're you really?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Birdwatcher.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I know you’re not what you say you are.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: And who're you?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I told you my name.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You settin’ us up?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: What does ‘settin’ up’ mean?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You don’t look like you belong in this.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: A man came here - He asked a friend to show you what you want. He was afraid so he asked me too.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’re not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes...But he said you may help - We should go. Suddenly they’re alerted by the GROANING ENGINE of a larg MILITARY TRUCK that quickly pulls into view. TEN ANGRY SOLDIERS wearing RED BERETS pile out.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Oh, God, please don’t say anything - Let me talk.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) What’re you doing here? Stay where you are! The TEN SOLDIERS surround BARNEY and SANDRA, WEAPONS held waist high.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You were told never to come close.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Why? You don’t own this place. Should we never leave our house? The SERGEANT LEADER steps uncomfortably close to SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You know better - You've been warned. The General’s daughter can be shot. BARNEY reacts to this.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish to the soldier) Then do what you want - We are leaving - We did nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: And him - Who is he? She violently shoves a SOLDIER. Suddenly the LEADER grabs SANDRA by the throat!  70

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Puta! Traitor! A RIFLE BUTT is buried into BARNEY’S KIDNEY. The LEADER j a PISTOL against BARNEY'S TEMPLE.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Take her to her father! The LEADER goes to strike SANDRA with his PISTOL, but a K suddenly buries itself into his CHEST. CHRISTMAS steps fr his concealment.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Run! BARNEY snatches the REVOLVER from the DEAD LEADER. SANDRA takes off as CHRISTMAS throws another KNIFE throug the NECK of SOLDIER #2. Dropping low, BARNEY blows a hole through SOLDIER #3 and BARNEY then wheels around hitting SOLDIER #5 directly und the chin then SOLDIER #6 under his chin. Christmas nails soldier #7. SANDRA is running for her life as SOLDIER #8 races after Rushing forward, CHRISTMAS whips another KNIFE that burie itself into SOLDIER #9’s chest. The throaty engine of the TRANSPORT TRUCK roars to life a CHRISTMAS races into view. Without breaking stride CHRISTMAS tears into view and yan the THROWING KNIFE out of DEAD SOLDIER #9’s body, then ra through the foliage attempting to intercept the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY TRUCK
dialogues.text: The truck’s frantic DRIVER yells into a WALKIE TALKIE as SOLDIER #8 attempts to shove Sandra onto the TRUCK, when KNIFE buries itself into his back. The DRIVER is still yelling into his WALKIE TALKIE when T SHOTS coming from behind CHRISTMAS blows the DRIVER #10 f first into the WINDSHIELD - The SHOOTER is BARNEY.  71 72 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bearded LIEUTENANT monitors the truck driver’s panicked transmission on his WALKIE-TALKIE, then the shots. Around are SIX SOLDIERS. EXT./INT. MONROE’S JEEP PAINE drives, MONROE is riding shotgun, in a foul mood. W his phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: What? EXT. SANDRA’S TRUCK - DAY BARNEY drives the small TRUCK at breakneck speed down the treacherous road. INT. SANDRA’S TRUCK

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) We get outta here it’s a miracle - She’s going with us?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: She better.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (frightened) Going where? How can we leave?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We have a plane. SANDRA says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAINE and MONROE speed toward the village. INT. SANDRA’S TRUCK - DAY

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Can’t leave!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You’ve don’t have a choice.  77

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (loudly) Yes I do - I won’t run ever!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: They’11 find you in an hour!

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Maybe, but I am staying!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: There’s nothin’ here!

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Not to you!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (hard) Stay and you’re dead!! - You’re leavin’!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRUCK speeds towards the SEAPLANE MOORING. As they approach, the island’s CUSTOMS SHACK comes into v BARNEY skids the TRUCK nearly into a TREE and cuts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Fire it up - (gestures to the customs shack) I‘ll take them.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Give me a thirty second lead! Pointing to the customs shack. CHRISTMAS grabs a startled SANDRA’S hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It’‘ll be alright. As Barney sprints toward the plane, Christmas anxiously checks the sweeping SECONDS HAND of his watch.  78 79 80

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: In a JEEP a contingent of Garza’s troops barrel wildly do the narrow street nearly slamming into the many poor VEND and PEDESTRIANS, who leap from the thundering vehicle’s p One of the soldiers is yelling into a hand held RADIO as jeep’s HORN blares at an oncoming TRUCK that veers violen onto the sidewalk, and crashes into a STOREFRONT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monroe and PAINE and the other men race their JEEP at breakneck speed through the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS jumps onto the PONTOON and whips open the huge planes’ SIDE DOOR. He turns to find Sandra standing still the dock.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Cc’mon! SANDRA balks. CHRISTMAS heaves the MOORING LINES free.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Jump! Get in!! Hesitantly, SANDRA takes a step forward grabbing his hand hand, then suddenly she stops.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No - I can’t!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s go!! What are you doin’? She starts to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: C’mon, there’s no time!

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Go! You go! You don’t belong here! I do!! Go! Go! SANDRA tears her hand from his. Having no choice, CHRISTM leaps inside.  81 82 83 84 85 86 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garza’s men continue to dangerously wheel their vehicle wildly through the narrow streets. The PORT now comes int view. One of the men snatches up the HAND MIC of the Jeep’s CB RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO SOLDIERS, who had been playing cards, are momenta startled as the Seaplane’s ENGINES roar to life. They don hear BARNEY entering through the REAR DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the huge ENGINES and thundering PROPS resoun throughout the port area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The startled SOLDIERS leap to their feet. In that split second, BARNEY smashes the first SOLDIER wi CHAIR as the SECOND SOLDIER is knocked unconscious by a . PISTOL that BARNEY pulls from the small of his back. The CUSTOMS OFFICIAL attempts to flee, but BARNEY fires a SHO into the back of his leg, dropping the man instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiping the sweat from his eyes, CHRISTMAS anxiously looks BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: C’mon, c’mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rumbling SEAPLANE powers along the SHORT DOCK, it’ whirling PROPS kick up a MASSIVE wall of SPRAY.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: bursts out of the SHACK, dashes along to the PIER and lea through the blinding spray landing on the plane’s HUGE PONTOONS at the last possible second.  88 89 90 91 92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing this, CHRISTMAS jams the throttles and the unbridl horsepower violently shakes the plane’s entire structure. Struggling against the hurricane force of the PROP WASH, BARNEY manages to pull himself inside.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: who is partially hidden behind the corner of a nearby structure, observes this then rushes toward her TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely drenched, Christmas swings into the copilot’s seat.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
