dialogues.text: Where’s the girl?!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Gone! She wouldn’t leave! Glancing out of the side COCKPIT WINDOW, BARNEY sees the TRANSPORT with Garza’s soldiers roar into view.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Get the memory card?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why the hell would she wanna stay? CHRISTMAS jams the throttle to max power and the ENGINES like unchained beasts.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: «+-Hell with it.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: reaches her truck just as the SOLDIERS’ JEEP rolls past.

dialogues.speaker: JEEP
dialogues.text: Skidding to a stop the SOLDIERS pile out and fire wildly.  93 94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS are at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to plane) Come on, baby! Climb! Still at the controls, Barney manages a glimpse of SANDRA speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: DOCK
dialogues.text: Monroe and his men speed towards the soldiers and slide t shuttering stop. Monroe leaps out then viciously rips a SOLDIER'S RIFLE out of the startled man’s hands, and begi FIRING at the rising PLANE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Out of AMMO and enraged, he snatches another SOLDIER’S RI and FIRES until the CLIP is empty.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when it appears they’re out of harm’s way, Monroe’s bullets rip through the rear of the plane’s fuselage. MORE BULLETS tear into the plane as BARNEY suddenly SNAPS STEERING WHEEL hard. The old SEA PLANE tilts drastically it’s side.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What the hell you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I wanna rip ‘em apart.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ‘Cause they ‘deserve’ it. CHRISTMAS gets out of his seat.  99

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (automatically) Fry an’ die?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. CHRISTMAS opens a HATCH under the console leading to the of the AIRCRAFT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MASSIVE SEAPLANE suddenly bursts into view over the towering cliffs.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Enters the HATCH. A hundred and twenty mile an hour wind pours in. He flips open a PAIR of GUN PORTS and jacks bac the bolts on a pair of AIRCRAFT MACHINE GUNS. His head ri into view and seen through the windshield, gives BARNEY t thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of THUNDERING ENGINES startles the SOLDIERS and Monroe and his men, who were in the process of departing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the COCKPIT WINDSHIELD, BARNEY sees the SOLDIERS frozen in confusion. BARNEY gives CHRISTMAS the thumbs up goes into a steep dive. CHRISTMAS appears to be riding the most lethal roller coa ever created as he prepares to open fire with powerful MACHINE GUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stunned SOLDIERS begin to fire at the SEAPLANE when CHRISTMAS cuts loose with a rain of hellfire that literal shreds everything in it’s path. Huge shreds of concrete a blasted from the pier and the JEEPS and TROOP TRUCK are t to pieces. MONROE and PAINE stare in horror as they realize death is near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS observe the destruction below and st two hundred yards away, BARNEY looks at CHRISTMAS, who gi him a thumbs up through the windshield. BARNEY returns th gesture. BARNEY then turns the HANDLE on the floor beside seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having reached it’s maximum speed, the SHUTTERING plane swoops towards the damaged dock. A shower of GAS begins t pour from the WING PODS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS removes a FLARE PISTOL attached to the hatch wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fleeing SOLDIERS freeze when they see a thick whirlin YELLOW CLOUD of mist about to descend on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only twenty feet above the dock, CHRISTMAS leans from the HATCH and fires the FLARE GUN at the drenched dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RED HOT FLARE collides against the OLD CONCRETE STRUC and a mammoth curling FIREBALL erupts with colossal force

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: who have remained on the PIER now leap into the water as curling wave of destruction envelops everything in it’s p The curling FLAMES sweep over the JEEPS, blowing them sky high. The burning wreckage crashes into the water, nearly crushing SEVERAL SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE is barely avoiding a catastrophe as the swirlin GAS WAVE threatens to reach up to the plane itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still leaning from the plane’s NOSE HATCH, CHRISTMAS’ eye show mounting pain as the FLAMES are curling up to the WI and GAS PODS. Christmas turns and through the windshield, BARNEY sees h urgently gesturing to ‘CUT THE GAS,’ and ‘BANK RIGHT.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY instantly snaps the GAS VALVE shut and, with all h strength, twists the WHEEL to the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TIDAL GAS WAVE ceases inches from the PLANE, which no ARCS gracefully out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the dock engulfed in FLAMES, Monroe and his men, alo with traumatized SOLDIERS, swim wearily to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARZA, in a special MERCEDES followed by a TROOP TRUCK fi with RED BERETS, stares in stunned silence at the SCORCHE DOCK. Rage wells in GARZA’S eyes as he searches for MONRO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS returns to the COCKPIT.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: That’s a rush. (no response) Ya alright? BARNEY barely nods and stares stoically straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (low) Yeah - Good job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRONING ENGINES now slowly fade into a TRANQUIL HUM a the AIRCRAFT glides gracefully into the SUNSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skip frame piece of security camera film of Barney and Christmas exiting Vilena customs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadowy office, with only the light of the compute screen and the images of Barney and Christmas playing ove and over, Monroe is barely able to contain his rage. The AMERICAN OPERATIVES are present plus TWO NEW RECRUITS tha stand in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Two obvious professionals just arrive, pass through your pathetic security personnel, wreak havoc and get away? I’m so annoyed I can’t feel my hands.

dialogues.speaker: 116A-B OMITTED
dialogues.text: PAINE faces MONROE. GARZA paces in the background.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: My men that were killed - Do you * even think about this? *

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (low and dry) What I think about is how your god * damn child brought this on! She should've been taken out a long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: I will never do that. *

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You won’t have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARZA storms out followed by THREE RED BERETS.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I need to know who these men are - Run through the photo recognition program.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I know ‘em. * MONROE turns to the shadows in the back of the room. Wher GUNNAR steps into the light.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Who's he?

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: One of the new hires.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You know where to find ‘em? * GUNNAR remains silent. MONROE stares unwaveringly into hi eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I didn’t get that. GUNNAR remains silent. *

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You toying with me? Do you or don’t * you know where they are? *

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (Gunnar stares straight ahead) Truthfully? To remove them - Where * are they? * GUNNAR locks eyes with MONROE, registering nothing. MONRO tempers his emotions and glances at PAINE, who steps forw

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (to Gunnar) Step over here. * PAINE and GUNNAR move several yards away. PAINE turns and faces GUNNAR, but can still see MONROE clearly in the background.  120

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: You know why I wanted to hire you? ‘Cause I know you, I’ve been through the shit you’ve been through an’ I’m not blind. Your eyes tell me you’re hurtin,’ like has your whole life been a waste? You want a future that won’t be as worthless as your past. We all do. (calmly) Look at me -— (Gunnar raises his eyes) You're here ‘cause they didn’t want you - This is your ‘family’ now, this is where you put your loyalty now. GUNNAR lowers his eyes to the ground pondering the statem as PAINE nods to MONROE, ‘We got him.’ INT. TOOL’S - PRE-SUNRISE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the COMPUTER SCREEN are a HALF DOZEN assorted PICTURES of MONROE and his MEN moving through town, which were taken CHRISTMAS’ hidden VIDEO CAMERA. Barney, Christmas, Hale Caesar, and Toll Road watch Yang expertly manipulate fast moving images on all four of his computer screens simultaneously. He points from screen to screen.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Taking the footage you shot, I was able to isolate this man - (the footage freezes on Monroe riding in the jeep) I ran it through data bases. CIA. FBI. Interpol. Old KGB, and got this. The screens light with matching pictures of Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: His name is James Monroe. CIA counter-intel. Field officer. These others...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pictures of PAINE, and the TWO OTHER OPERATIVES come up.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: More of the same - All ex-CIA. CHRISTMAS sees an IMAGE of one of the other OPERATIVES (G Daniels.)

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Wait! I know him! Toby Lewis. We were stationed at Royal Marine Training Camp in Scotland - He was always a demented bastard. More pictures come flashing on the screens.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Stop. Yang hits a key. One screen freezes. A group picture, wit Monroe standing next to a man we recognize as...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’s the guy who contacted us - Calls himself Mr. Church.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: No. His name is... He hits some keys...

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: George Compson. CounterIntel Operations Manager.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Christ, we’re working for the agency.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Man, I’ve seen this show before. He points to the MAP on one of the screens showing VILENA

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: ‘Asia,’ ‘Panama,’ ‘Afganastan’ — It’s about drugs, Brothers, with big time cash flowin’ down the covert pipeline, financin’ all kinds of punk ass puppets and death squads like we got goin’ on right here! He angrily slaps the table. + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: An’ sooner or later them good ol’ boys take what’s left of that poison north an’ Boom, it’s flowin’ through the hood like a God damn nose bleed. An’ don’t be lookin’ at me like I’m talkin’ “crazy man conspiracy theory,” ‘cause I need a calculator to add up people I’ve known who now reside on the wrong side of the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS faces BARNEY. BARNEY is becoming more distant.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: This Monroe creep must’ve went rogue and took it all after the agency set it all up - Washington can’t just send in the Army to kill one of their own - makes for bad press. So they drop a ton of money on our motley asses to do their ‘wet work.’

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Then we’re taken out.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let ‘em eat each other.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Man, when we gonna see money like that? Never.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s kick it around.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: We vote?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We don’t have the manpower, the firepower or know the layout. We’re out. BARNEY heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF +e HF

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 70
dialogues.text: INT. SANDRA’S HOUSE - NIGHT A HALF DOZEN SOLDIERS holding powerful HALOGEN FLASHLIGHT tear through the house. EXT. SANDRA’S HOUSE - NIGHT As the SOLDIERS pour out of the dwelling, we see that SANDRA’S NEIGHBORS have been pulled from their homes and being brutally interrogated by Paine and his men. MONROE GARZA look on.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Where is she? Where is the girl?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Enjoy the breeze. GARZA steps forward and stands in front of PAINE and slap the PEASANT hard. It is more of a show for MONROE’S benef

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Paine) Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a WOODED AREA down a slight BERM, a PAIR of SOLDIERS c across SANDRA’S TRUCK, which has been covered in BRANCHES PALMS. The TEN WHEEL TROOP TRUCK pulls SANDRA’S TRUCK into clear view as the SQUAD LEADER speaks into the ARMY TRUCK’S CB MICROPHONE. EXT. LACY’S HOUSE (PARKING LOT) - NIGHT CHRISTMAS pulls up to the CURB. He emotionally eyes LACY’ house. EXT. LACY’S HOUSE - NIGHT CHRISTMAS knocks on her door.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: .--Yes? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I wanna talk. (no reaction) One more time - C’mon, open the door. She opens the door. Her head held low.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Look, I’m not ready to let this go. CHRISTMAS sense something’s wrong. He gently lifts her ch His expression darkens when he sees her teary eyes and bruised face.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (hard) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The well-lit court is presently occupied by ‘Lacy’s boyfriend’ PAUL, playing three on three with five other b strong men. Christmas roars up on his motorcycle and LACY gets off th back.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Please, Lee, it’s over - It’s not worth it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Sure it is. CHRISTMAS drives the BIKE onto the COURT and very slowly drives in a wide circle around the whole dumbfounded team

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: What the hell’s that?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Some punk, don’t worry about it. CHRISTMAS continues to circle the MEN.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Whatta you want?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (calmly) -.-Your life. The TEAM eyes PAUL, who is beginning to tense up.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: -.-I’m thinkin’ about takin’ it.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (putting on a brave face) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah - But I don’t do well in tight spaces, so goin’ to prison worries me.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Watch it. Maybe he’s carryin’ something.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: He’s just runnin’ his mouth. About thirty feet away, CHRISTMAS parks the BIKE and dismounts.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (unnervingly calm) You shouldn’t have bruised her face.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: That’s not your business.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Sure it is - I kinda loved it the way it was.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Then keep the bitch. I’m done with her. Without a nanosecond of hesitation, CHRISTMAS charges up PAUL and starts pounding on him. Instantly he is jumped b the TEAMMATES. Now it’s really on. CHRISTMAS switches int full destruct mode and in the matter of a few heartbeats, MEN lay agonizing on the court.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 73
dialogues.text: PAUL gets up, faces CHRISTMAS. CHRISTMAS leaps up in the executes a perfect reverse spinning wheel kick, which connects with Paul’s jaw. He comes down, places the ball on the prostrated Paul’s chest. And with that he whips out one of his BLADES, buries it i the ball. The ball flattens.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Next time I deflate all of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Passes nervously along the fence as CHRISTMAS pulls up on MOTORCYCLE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Let's go. He hands over a SMALL HELMUT and she almost timidly gets

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Now you know what I do for a livin.’ He roars off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slides open. Barney flips on a light. Suspended the ceiling by chain pulleys is a plane engine. Barney be to lower it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN SOLDIERS have assaulted a FARMER who lies beaten to t ground. Begging for mercy, PAINE has the FARMER’S WIFE by throat. The GENERAL stands nearby wanting to impose his w

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Where is this girl ‘Sandra?’ Again, where? PAINE puts his GUN to the woman’s head. GARZA blurts out.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (in English) I will find her! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 74
dialogues.text: GARZA (cont'd) (in Spanish) If I ask again, you die!! The Farmer frantically points up the road.

dialogues.speaker: FARMER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) She’s up there, up there! PAINE lets her go and nods to a SOLDIER who heaves a Molo cocktail at the FARMHOUSE. GARZA bristles that PAINE is giving his TROOPS orders. He storms off into his MERCEDES LIMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various angles of BARNEY toiling away on the plane engine

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: EXT. GARZA’S PALACE - DUSK An ARMY TRUCK occupied with EIGHT SOLDIERS rumbles throug the gates. Monroe, Paine and his men wait. The truck grin to halt. The rear of the truck opens and a terrified Sand is tossed out. Paine grabs her by the hair. MONROE comes forward...GARZA watches from his BALCONY. Hi hatred for MONROE is mounting.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (calmly) ‘Sandra’, short for Alexandra, which is Greek for ‘defender of mankind.’ Bingo, here you are. Synergy. If you’re not following that, and you’re probably not, follow this - Just then a BOTTLE OF WHISKEY smashes to the ground near PAINE. Stunned, they glance up at GARZA, who glares at th and his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: You should have left!!!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I was going to say I’ve never believed in hitting women, true, heavy Christian upbringing, but hitting men of course. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 75
dialogues.text: MONROE (cont'd) But (points to Paine) this man does not have that moral dilemma, so now here’s the question - Why were the Americans here?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (to Garza in Spanish) Have my father kill me!! (she angrily pulls free) If you want me gone, you do it! You kill me! You kill who they want you to! Why not me?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARZA looks at her with dead eyes and backs from view. Without warning PAINE hauls off and back slaps SANDRA so across the face, her knees buckle. She then springs off t ground and attacks PAINE, digging her nails into his unprotected face. PAINE heaves her to the ground. He drags her off by the hair, into Garza’s Palace. As the doors slam shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY cannot concentrate any longer, setting down a WREN he starts to travel through the machinery until he reache SLIDING DOOR, and entering continues towards a FAINT LIGH He hears the faint sounds of music. Stepping forward, he comes upon TOOL, who is painting on the front of a GUITAR TOOL sees him in the reflection of a MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Don’t you ever sleep?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Where’s your friend?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (pained) Another one bites the dust - I was paintin’ this for her, which I’m gonna finish, let dry, then smash.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Wanna be alone?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Not really, no. So what’s up? BARNEY steps forward into the faint light.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: There was a woman on that island.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (still painting) Usually are.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She took us around - She was the target’s daughter. She had this chance to leave an’ didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: -.--Got guts.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why can’t I get this out of my head?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: She stands for somethin,’ Darkness. We don’t stand for shit, used to, but all that dried up like this paint’s gonna.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What dried up?

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: The human parts, Bro. Remember that op in Bosnia when we took down them Serb bad boys. After that day of bloodlettin’, I’m feeling kinda dead too - my head’s in a very black place, Dracula black, so I get this bottle of local fire water, ‘Slivowitz’ I think it was called an’ I’m feelin’ no pain when I come to this old wood bridge an’ see this woman standing on the rail. I look at her, she looks at me, an’ I know she’s gonna jump, but I just keep walking till I hear the splash. She’s gone. After taking all them lives, here was one I coulda saved, but didn’t. And what I realized later was, if I had saved that woman, I might’ve saved what was left of my soul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY takes it all in then drifts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH + eH + eH + eH  158

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 77
dialogues.text: EXT. TOOL’S SOCIAL CLUB We see BARNEY’S BLACK TRUCK pull up. INT. TOOL’S MACHINE SHOP - DAY BARNEY enters to the others.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’s up? The doors at the far end open, BARNEY enters, just starts as he approaches everyone.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I’m going back. The MEN just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Who’s in? Who’s out?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: What’s the plan?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We'll figure a ‘plan’ out on the way.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: So we'll just ‘feel’ our way through?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Trust me or not.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It’s not about trust, it’s about being smart.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: An’ about dyin.’ Man, we need a ‘plan’ made with the lights on.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You said it - We don’t know the ‘layout’ - How to get in, how to get out -

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Dead on arrival.  159 160 168

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I understand, but I gotta go. * The MEN are dumbfounded as BARNEY starts out. CHRISTMAS rushes up to him and grabs his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You're a stupid bastard. If it’s * about that woman, you don’t owe her * anything - If you wanna kill * yourself, do it here, I'll help you. But don’t lay this guilt crap * on us, we don’t deserve it. * BARNEY exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDRA, fighting it all the way, is dragged down the hall by PAINE until they come to a cell door. PAINE kicks the door open to reveal... TWO OPERATIVES standing beside a long WOOD TABLE. SANDRA knows what is about to happen, real terror fills h face. She struggles to get away. PAINE drags her into the room, Slams the door. EXT. TOOL’S - DAY BARNEY enters the cab and fires it up. Suddenly the PASSE door swings open and YANG jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Where’re you going?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: With you. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I don’t want you to. *

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: No, I do. * BARNEY throws the TRUCK into gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high angle shot of BARNEY’S TRUCK driving along the fri of the city.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: It’s difficult you know.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Being me is difficult.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Who's that? INT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - DAY BARNEY sits with YANG. EXT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - DAY As BARNEY'S TRUCK passes through an intersection, we see GUNNAR’S late model BRONCO swing into view.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Difficult because I have to work harder than the rest of them. EXT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - DAY We see GUNNAR’S VEHICLE closing in.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I’m not following.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Difficult because they’re taller - So everything is harder for me - When I get hurt, the wound is bigger, why? ‘cause I’m smaller. INT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - DAY BARNEY and YANG approach an intersection. A nondescript S casually drifts in front of BARNEY and pauses as the ligh turns RED.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: When I travel everything is farther because I’m smaller - My life is harder than you think.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I can’t follow this.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (nods ) I would like more money - a raise.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: To take care of your family, I know.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: I don’t have a family.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Don’t have a family.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So why’d you say you did?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Because someday maybe I will. So I say I do now. Who am I hurting? The raise is for me. EXT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - DAY 80 As they wait for the light to change, GUNNAR slowly cruis up to within 15 feet. GUNNAR reaches for a large AUTOMATIC PISTOL that rests on passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Just think it over.

dialogues.speaker: TRACTOR TRAILER TRUCK
dialogues.text: Pulls into the intersection and blocks BARNEY’S TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND YANG
dialogues.text: instantly realize they are boxed in. The NONDESCRIPT SEDA part of the set up.  171 172

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 81
dialogues.text: suv #1 A KILLER rolls down the REAR WINDOW and opens fire when BARNEY cranks the wheel of his TRUCK and slams BROADSIDE SUV #1. The KILLER’S BULLETS are impaled in the passenger side and driver’s side BULLET PROOF WINDOWS.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: jams his truck into reverse and wheels around into a 180 degree turn. With tires SMOKING like a bat out of hell, BARNEY floors the machine and the chase is on. The SIDE WINDOW of SUV #2 rolls down and an AUTOMATIC RIF is fired, splintering the passenger’s side window even mo BARNEY and YANG whip around and see SUV #2 and GUNNAR’S BRONCO charging after them. Gunnar whips his BRONCO around traffic, closing in on BAR BARNEY swings his truck beneath an UNDERPASS - They crash through barriers, as BULLETS bounce off of CEMENT PILLARS After a half dozen near misses, BARNEY and GUNNAR and the other KILLERS then exit the UNDERPASS. BARNEY tears into oncoming traffic. They all weave throug DOZEN oncoming cars. The trailing NONDESCRIPT SEDAN is set up and t-boned into LARGE DUMP TRUCK. Then YANG removes a MACHINE PISTOL from behind the seat and kicks out the near shredded passenger side window and fires at GUNNAR as BARNEY whips the TRUCK into 180 degree turn. BARNEY straightens out the TRUCK an the chase continues. In the near distance he spots an industrial area. Smoke r from TONS of smoldering refuse being burned. BARNEY races towards a massive dilapidated FACTORY. BARNEY plows the TRUCK through one of the factory’s old l WINDOWS. GUNNAR follows. GLASS SPLINTERS everywhere. BARN speeds ahead and whips into 180 degree turn and races tow GUNNAR.

dialogues.speaker: BRONCO
dialogues.text: GUNNAR floors the BRONCO and charges head on into BARNEY’ path. It looks as if BARNEY is the ‘chicken’ as he swerve aside.  177 182

dialogues.speaker: STEEL STRUCTURE
dialogues.text: BARNEY’S succeeded luring GUNNAR into the trap by clippin the STEEL SUPPORT BEAM, allowing machinery to crash down front of GUNNAR, but BARNEY is knocked into semi- consciousness. GUNNAR’S eyes widen in horror as his BRONCO catapults sev feet into the air and lands upside down.

dialogues.speaker: BRONCO
dialogues.text: The badly damaged vehicle lays on it’s side, STEAM pourin from under the hood. BARNEY’S TRUCK As YANG leans over to BARNEY to pull him upright, GUNSHOT rip through the silence and BULLETS tear into the TRUCK’S SIDE.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: YANG leaves BARNEY and rolls from the TRUCK. BLOODY and b shaken up, he puts his pain aside and moves forward. Suddenly the high caliber PISTOL is KICKED from GUNNAR’S by YANG. YANG commences to ferociously attack GUNNAR. GUNNAR is da and staggers against a clump of TREES. YANG goes in for t kill, but GUNNAR rises and strikes YANG with an arching b fist delivered by his MASSIVE ARM. Now it’s GUNNAR’S turn attack.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: kicks YANG with such brute force, YANG is sent flying, an collides in a semi-conscious state. GUNNAR charges after YANG attacks GUNNAR who again dominates with his incredib strength and grabs YANG by the throat in a similar fashio the first scene. BARNEY is coming to and reaches under the dash and touche LATCH and a .45 CALIBER PISTOL drops into view. YANG cracks GUNNAR across his EYES which frees him up. YA then zeroes in on his stunned opponent and proceeds to ra back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Badly weakened by the barrage, GUNNAR’S knees are repeate assaulted, but though he tries to ignore the pain, his le are finally weakened by a ferocious kick that shatters hi right knee. YANG, exhausted and bloody studies the man fo moment then moves off. GUNNAR’S hand finds his PISTOL clo by and raises the PISTOL. BARNEY fires and GUNNAR collapses to the ground. YANG sta at his foe. YANG moves off and passes BARNEY in silence. BARNEY goes GUNNAR and kneels beside the mortally wounded man.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Why’d you shoot me? *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You were gonna kill ‘im.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (softly) No...myself... (soft revelation) Am I dyin’? GUNNAR’S breathing becomes increasingly labored.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Who sent you?

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (barely audible) What a waste. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Gunnar, who hired you? GUNNAR’S eyes slowly shut. He’s moments from death.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Tell me - Who? - I’1ll make it * right.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Promise you'll bury me right. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. * GUNNAR’S eyes slightly open and his BLOODY HAND weakly ri and cups BARNEY’S neck and almost gently pulls him forwar until his mouth is next to his ear.  183 184

dialogues.speaker: YANG.
dialogues.text: Leaning against the DAMAGED SUV watching the final moment between BARNEY and GUNNAR play out. INT. SANDRA’S CELL (WATER BOARDING TORTURE) SANDRA is pinned to a low WOODEN TABLE by PAINE and anoth AMERICAN OPERATIVE. SANDRA’S FACE is covered with a RAG a the THIRD OPERATIVE pours water from a DENTED PITCHER dow SANDRA’S throat. She gags and struggles like she’s being drowned, which she is. Suddenly, GARZA’S THREE SPECIAL RE BERETS charge into the room and violently shove one OPERA aside while the OTHER smashes the WATER PITCHER to the fl PAINE attempts to draw his PISTOL, but is facing down one the other RED BERETS’ AUTOMATIC RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: You said you would question her - Not treat her like an animal!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You want answers?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Not this way - (to guards) Take her to a cell. The GUARDS guide her semi-conscious body forward. She eye her father, who can’t match her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: I will question her - You and them stay away. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Whatever you say. GARZA exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY’S TRUCK approaches the dilapidated structure. The of the OLD SEAPLANE extends beyond the opening of the HAN  193 194 195

dialogues.text: The plane’s DOOR swings open and stepping inside, BARNEY a sight that stops him cold. TOLL ROAD, HALE CAESAR and CHRISTMAS are waiting inside. YANG drifts in behind BARNE

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: .-.-It’s not easy being your friend. BARNEY is truly touched.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Man, we'll die with ya, that’s cool, just don’t ask us to do it twice.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Fair enough, I know the layout.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (getting behind the wheel) Tell ya on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE’S REAR ROARING ENGINES reverberate through the nighttime sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY is seated in the COCKPIT. He is presently on the PHONE. In the rear of the fuselage are CHRISTMAS, YANG, T ROAD and HALE CAESAR under an ADJUSTABLE LIGHT. They are checking their WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...I want the rest of the money wired into the account number I gave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHURCH is seated in the rear. TWO other CIA types are in FRONT SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: You’1l be ‘whole’ when it’s done.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We’re turning around.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Why should I trust you? *

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yes or no? *

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Alright, it’s done, but Barney - * Listen close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY is seated in the COCKPIT. CHRISTMAS drifts up and enters the CO-PILOT SEAT.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah? *

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: You embarass me, I’1l have the skin * pulled off you losers - Believe * that. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the moonlight the commanding SEAPLANE glides gracefull above the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rear compartment, TOLL ROAD and HALE CAESAR sit am the CARGO. HALE CAESAR has his AA-12 AUTOMATIC SHOTGUN leaned agains the wall as he loads the weapon’s AMMO DRUM.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: The enemy’s terrified of noise, especially shotguns, an’ when this big boy’s spittin’ out 250 rounds a minute, you tell me what’s toleratin’ that? Zero - Meet my girlfriend - * HALE CAESAR pulls out what appears to be a MINIATURE WARH that fits into a SHOTGUN SHELL, which he pridefully displ

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: ‘Omaya Kaboom.’

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Ya lost me.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: When Omaya’s primer’s struck, she really gets off an’ a miniature warhead that does arm itself an’ when that event happens, anything standin’ in my lady’s way will become instant red sauce and Jello.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: You should meet my doctor. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS are in the COCKPIT, YANG sits behind them.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Gunnar tries to kill you, you shoot him an’ at death’s door he gives you a whole layout.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: As best he could.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I guess we owe the big bastard a send off.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: I would've won. CHRISTMAS pulls out a BOTTLE OF WHISKEY and takes a slug. passes it to BARNEY who does likewise. This is a standard chanting ritual before going to battle. He passes it to Y who drinks. HALE CAESAR begins. They all chime in.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Beware, beware, walk with care, Boomlay, boomlay, boomlay, boom. We are sinners, yet purer than sin. We see heaven, we’ll never get in. Boomlay, BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: 211B
dialogues.text: 211Cc

dialogues.text: As he steps away, we see the most disturbing painting yet which has GARZA appearing with blackened features and a violent slash of YELLOW across his face.

dialogues.text: Several hundred yards off shore the island comes into vie Several SOLDIERS’ ‘heat signatures’ are seen via the THER IMAGING SCREEN patrolling around the pier area.

dialogues.text: MONROE, PAINE and TWO other EX-AMERICAN OPERATIVES step outside. They behold a HUNDRED AND FIFTY SOLDIERS spread before them. Standing beneath GARZA’S quarters are THIRTY FIVE RED BER with their faces painted in a fearsome design. They are i SEMI-CIRCLE. MONROE and PAINE eye one another, as they try to mentally compute the surreal and unnerving sight. GENERAL GARZA’S outline standing on the balcony. Cigar sm drifts like a ghost in the dead night air.

dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of HEAVY WIRE CUTTERS clipping a section of the SECURITY FENCE.

dialogues.text: We see FOUR DARK FIGURES dash among the shadow. In the foreground, SOLDIERS are seen milling around the COURTYAR  212 213

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 89
dialogues.text: INT. PALACE (GARZA’S CHAMBERS) - NIGHT Sipping whiskey, GENERAL GARZA sits behind his desk. He i touches the BARREL of a MINIATURE CANNON that is a DESK ORNAMENT, as MONROE, PAINE and OPERATIVE #2 and #3 enter. room is only lit by EXTENSIVE CANDLE LIGHT. Some of the CANDLES are immense, OVER SIX FEET TALL.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Downstairs I saw soldiers with painted faces. So is there a reason you’ve taken men I’ve broke my ass to train to be serious combat personnel and painted them?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: They look like warriors!

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: They look like fools!

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Warriors loyal to me - When does the battle begin?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Battle? Everything’s under control.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: From that side of the room, maybe. From this side nothing is under control. I can see you thinkin’ ‘the General’s not thinkin’ straight.’ Yes, that could be, but it is also you that is not thinkin’ right and I can see you want to go and not see me again until the morning. No, stay! I want company - You will watch me paint. THREE RED BERETS block the exit, they’re ready to fight. MONROE glares at GARZA, who stares blankly into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RED BERET GUARD carrying an AUTOMATIC WEAPON is patroll beside the palace. A BLUR passes in front of the SOLDIER’S face as YANG kick him in the jaw. The man collapses in an inglorious heap.  214 215 216 217 219 220

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 90
dialogues.text: Immediately BARNEY and TOLL ROAD drag him away to a dark corner against the palace wall as CHRISTMAS and HALE CAES alertly scan the area. Just off to the side is FAINT LIGH emanating from a GRATE.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: ...Nice view.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Alright, it’s 3:36. We’ve got 20 minutes to bring this place down - I‘ll take the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The majority of the regular SOLDIERS are in their makeshi TENT BARRACKS located in the FRONT COURTYARD. The painted face RED BERETS still stand guard over the PALACE ENTRANC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of GUARDS are stationed at the end of a long corri TOLL ROAD comes into view. His SILHOUETTE is seen dashing across the hallway past the slumping guards...He places another RADIO ACTIVATED CHARGE against a SUPPORT COLUMN, gracefully disappears.

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT TUNNELS
dialogues.text: BARNEY exits a staircase and moves down the dim corridor. Flipping on a MINI LIGHT attached to his assault RIFLE, h eyes the cross section of a bearing wall overhead.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA'S CHAMBER
dialogues.text: With his eyes fixated on the CANVAS, GARZA stares dully straight ahead as MONROE is seated behind GARZA’S desk. A MONROE eyes the PHOTOS of SANDRA, his mind races.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: On the second floor, he places an EXPLOSIVE in another strategic locale.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: A pair of GUARDS move down the dim hallway on the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 91
dialogues.text: A FOOT flies out of the doorway knocking one guard cold. CAESAR sweeps the second GUARD off his feet and puts him sleep with an elbow to the forehead. He places an EXPLOSI and splits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the GUARDS idly pacing overhead, YANG plants a rigge charge against a POST, then moves on to the next post.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Moving along the basement tunnels, BARNEY moves further d the corridor. By the glow of his MINI-FLASHLIGHT, he find another SUPPORT BEAM overhead. His attention is drawn to tightly wrapped WHITE BRICKS. Drawing a knife, he cuts on open and PURE COCAINE pours out.

dialogues.speaker: HALL GUARD, (HALE CAESAR)
dialogues.text: A SOLDIER minds his post. His eyes become alert when he h movement off to his side. Turning his head in that direct he peers into the dimly lit distance. Nothing there. Slow turning his head back, we see HALE CAESAR’S bone chilling presence behind the GUARD. In a flash a python-like FOREA whips around his throat and they wipe from frame.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: plants another charge against the SECURITY FENCE. He reac in and opens the release TAPS to large GASOLINE STORAGE CONTAINERS. The FLUID begins to flow along the fence.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: A SOLDIER passes an alcove. TOLL ROAD leaps from view and a highly original maneuver, breaks him in half.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: slips down the hallway, approaching GENERAL GARZA’S Chamb as he takes out a SENTRY. CHRISTMAS drags the body into an ADJOINING ROOM as the LA MAN passes. Without hesitation, he places a CHARGE at the base of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: plants a CHARGE near the ENTRY GATES.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: plants a charge against another portion of the palace’s FOUNDATION. Again he sees more massive packaged STACKS of COCAINE. Checking his WATCH, he bolts off with a heighten sense of purpose.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: is placing a CHARGE just as a GUARD holding a FLASHLIGHT opens the door. Without so much as a second of hesitation, HALE CAESAR st out of the darkness and skull butts the GUARD. He crumble

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Climbs onto the PALACE ROOF. It is an eerie sight. Up ahe are TWO SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Climbs onto the PALACE ROOF. From his vantage point he ca see TOLL ROAD. He gestures to move ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ROOF GUARDS
dialogues.text: Are at opposite ends of the wide roof. One turns and is slammed squarely in the center of his face with a STUDDED MUAY THAI knee kick. CHRISTMAS at nearly the same instant renders his man unconscious. He stares over the edge at t SOLDIERS mulling around in the COURTYARD, then places his CHARGE. Likewise TOLL ROAD.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: glides down the dark stone corridor. He pauses. In the distance, he sees the glow of a CIGARETTE belonging to on the TWO GUARDS standing in front of SANDRA’S dank cell. T passe from view mumbling in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 93
dialogues.text: SANDRA’S CELL The GUARDS enter. The LARGER GUARD’S CIGARETTE is glowing the dim light. They stare down at SANDRA, who is bound to CHAIR and BLINDFOLDED.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA'S CHAMBERS
dialogues.text: The GENERAL'S eyes are clouded over. PAINE and the TWO OPERATIVES just stare at the unpredictable dictator. He m the final stroke.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: ..-This clears the mind. GARZA stares at MONROE with a long unnerving pause.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: ...What? We see the PAINTING as GARZA’S eyes bore into the CANVAS. is a painting of his daughter rushing past a burning landscape.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Do you have puppets at home?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: No - But you think you have one here in front of you - Do you think I’m your puppet?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: No, that’s just in your mind.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (rising) Is it?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (loudly) I want you to calm down!

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: You want! (to Red Beret in Spanish) He wants!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I’m trying real hard to figure out what’s going on in your head.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: You! - You’re in there! I thought maybe the people of Vilena paid these mercenaries to kill me - I thought that! But then I think maybe this is your plan because you can’t control me. Then I think that torturing my daughter works for you. I feel it. But she is now loyal to me and you want to kill her to make me suffer. A man can never kill a child, but you can.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You’re losing your mind!

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: You do not control me anymore!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (losing it) Control you? I own you! The RED BERETS step forward, holding their WEAPONS at the ‘ready.’ In the DIM CANDLELIGHT, they present a terrifyin vision.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (forcefully) Nobody owns me! No more!! Bring my daughter here! Bring her! She knows who is doing this! Bring her now! Bring her in front of me and I will ask her if she is loyal to you or me! Bring her or I'll kill all of you!! PAINE looks to MONROE, who’s thoroughly exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Get her!!

dialogues.speaker: CELL GUARDS
dialogues.text: One of the sleazy CELL GUARDS touches SANDRA’S hair, samp the texture. Blindfolded, she recoils and curses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OTHER ONE touches her neck then her breasts. She curs and spits in rage. The GUARD enjoys this and kicks her CH over.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Too good for us. The SECOND GUARD draws hard on a CIGARETTE until the embe glows firey RED. As the GUARD goes to burn SANDRA, we see a bright STEEL B slash through the darkness and the hand holding the red h CIGARETTE is severed. Still blindfolded, SANDRA’S body convulses when she hears the man’s anguished scream. BARN then plunges the huge dagger’s blade into the other SOLDI chest, then silences the first SOLDIER’S SCREAMS with a n thrust. Their heavy bodies collapse beside SANDRA, who’s screaming hysterically. BARNEY covers her mouth as he whi off her BLINDFOLD.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (hysterical in Spanish) No! No! Don’t hurt me! No more! Please! No more!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Sandra, it’s me! It’s me! Nobody will hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (calming) How are you here?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (cutting her loose) Can you move? BARNEY helps her stand.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After placing his final CHARGE, YANG checks his WATCH and quickly moves off.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE TUNNELS
dialogues.text: BARNEY and SANDRA move down a large tunnel, which is dull lit by several LOW WATT hanging bulbs. PAINE suddenly explodes from his concealment and slams BA with a forearm across the face. SANDRA screams, BARNEY crumbles. PAINE drops a knee to BARNEY’S midsection. The other TWO OPERATIVES and a huge RED BERET SOLDIER step in view. OPERATIVE #2 grabs BARNEY in a lethal choke hold, yanking upright. OPERATIVE #1 strips BARNEY of his WEAPONS includ the LONG DAGGER KNIFE, PAINE strikes BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATIVE
dialogues.text: (gesturing towards Barney weapons ) I’m claimin’ these weapons when we're done. + eH

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Please, don’t hit him! Please! Take me, this is not his fight!! With blood boiling, PAINE grabs SANDRA by the throat and tosses her to the RED BERET.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Get her the hell upstairs! Seal the building! (to Barney) I’m breakin’ you apart. *

dialogues.speaker: RENDEZVOUS POINT, (OUTSIDE THE PALACE)
dialogues.text: TOLL ROAD, HALE CAESAR, YANG and CHRISTMAS have dropped t one knee. Their anxiety mounting.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Times up - Where’s Barney?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: What’s the call?  238

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Give it 10 minutes - We can’t find ‘em, we’re going out the same way we came in.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: No way!!

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: That’s what he’d want!!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - Ten minutes! The MEN bolt off.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: glares into BARNEY'S defiant eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Why’re you here?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Bird watchin.’ PAINE throws an elbow shot that lands with colossal force BARNEY’S chest. BARNEY sags.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATIVE
dialogues.text: That’1l leave a mark.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Who hired you?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Your boyfriend. PAINE slams him again. As BARNEY buckles, PAINE motions t OPERATIVE #1. The BRITISH OPERATIVE steps around PAINE.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATIVE
dialogues.text: Glad you came back. OPERATIVE #1 unleashes an incredible barrage of kicks tha have BARNEY barely grasping onto consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATIVE
dialogues.text: You know without the Kevlar vest, you’re insides are gone. OPERATIVE #1 releases the VELCRO holding on BARNEY’S PROTECTIVE VEST.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATIVE
dialogues.text: He wanted you to be conscious.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Last time - Give me the right answer, I’1l give you a break. (holds up his fist) Don’t, I will crush your heart against your spine and death’s a given. Last time, who sent you?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Your hairdresser. Enraged, PAINE draws back for the killshot, just as YANG drops through the overhead GRATE and brutally sidekicks P to the mid-section. He then kicks the American Operative releasing BARNEY as YANG attacks Operative #1. CHRISTMAS drops down next, slamming a potent ELBOW into OPERATIVE #3’s JAW. TOLL ROAD comes charging out of the darkness and tears into the RED BERET SOLDIERS, who themselves are great fighters. PAINE moves out of the fra PAINE turns and is hit by BARNEY, which drives him back slightly and they end up in a dismal, barely lit room. PA uses his superior strength to dominate. BARNEY is slammed hard to the brick floor. He goes to pull his short barrel PISTOL from behind his back. PAINE goes to stomp BARNEY, rolls and hooks PAINE’S leg. They roll around punches at close quarters. BARNEY is on his feet and rains down a torrent of punches that has PAINE on his heels.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNELS
dialogues.text: Just as YANG, CHRISTMAS, and TOLL ROAD have subdued their opponents, a SQUAD of TEN BERETS come pouring into the tunnels and open fire, pinning our guys against the wall. Lethal CHUNKS of MORTAR and STONE are ripped from the dam walls.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: In a brutal choke hold, the escalated gunfire draws his attention. Sensing that the battle is getting out of hand moves off into the darkness. BARNEY gasps for air, then r to one knee.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: is now tucked in a RECESS in the cement wall, firing his MILLIMETER and takes a SLUG in the forearm.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 99
dialogues.text: Flushed with confidence, the SOLDIERS move boldly toward their pinned victims. TOLL ROAD, CHRISTMAS and YANG attempt to return fire, but being overwhelmed. Suddenly a thunderous volley rattles every stone in the tunnel as the TEN RED BERETS are blown off their feet fro behind. Through the haze we see HALE CAESAR and his smoki AA-12 SUPER SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Remember this shit at Christmas! BARNEY steps out of the tunnel looking battered. He goes retrieve his weapons.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let’s move.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNELS
dialogues.text: The EXPENDABLES are running through the long, dark CORRID GARZA’'S CHAMBERS A GUARD enters with SANDRA. She locks eyes with her fathe who looks quite ashamed. A RED BERET drops a BAG of MONEY in front of MONROE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to an operative) What the hell is he doing?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Everything bad that has happened, you bring. Take your money - I see only death with you. Take it all!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere.  241

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (brandishing a sword) * Take it! We are done here!!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You can’t succeed without me -

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Succeed? I am president!!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: President!? You're a greaser ina hat! * Enraged, GARZA raises a SWORD to kill MONROE. *

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No!! * GARZA lowers the SWORD and goes to his daughter. They * exchange looks that reveal their emotional turmoil. *

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You are who I should've been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy OAK DOOR swings open onto the PALACE COURTYARD the men pour out into the darkness. Suddenly they are hit flush with FOUR intense SPOTLIGHTS. straight ahead and TWO from above on the PALACE ROOF. GARZA’'S CHAMBERS The glare from the powerful FLOOD LIGHT streams into the office. GARZA steps forward and stares out from the BALCO PAINE enters.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: The chopper’s ready in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Paine) ...We’re not the ones leaving! MONROE snatches up SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The EXPENDABLES remain immobile as a hundred plus SOLDIER step out from the darkness behind the huge spotlights. Th catch a glimpse of the foreboding painted RED BERET.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE BALCONY
dialogues.text: GENERAL GARZA savors the visual of his enemies captured below.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Drop the weapons or you will be killed now!! MONROE steps into view, he grips the back of SANDRA’S NEC BARNEY and CHRISTMAS see this.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ---Shit.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND GROUP
dialogues.text: scan the area looking for survival options. There are non GARZA’S BALCONY

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (ignoring Monroe) The American invader is out there. (points to the mercenaries) And in here - They come here to kill this country, to take all this for themselves!! Forgive me - I am guilty of being human, of greed - (looks at Monroe) For poisonin’ our land with drugs, with death.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Stupid bastard -

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: From tonight, fresh air, fresh water, clean, healthy land, no more corruption, no more suffering. (in English) We will kill this American disease and start new.  245

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 102
dialogues.text: Suddenly GARZA pitches forward from a BULLET in his back. turns and is hit twice more. GARZA staggers backwards and falls over the railing. The GUARDS go to shoot back, but MONROE and PAINE blow them away in a flash.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No, God! No!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Paine) Get the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLDIERS remain frozen at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RED BERET CONTINGENT now comes to their senses and al open fire on the EXPENDABLES, who are hopelessly pinned d

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Blow the place!!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY'S
dialogues.text: fingers unfold. A REMOTE SWITCH is revealed in his palm. flicks a secondary SWITCH and a TINY RED LIGHT appears.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: She’s still in there!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We're dyin’ here - Blow it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney’s thumb is about to press the IGNITION BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Cover me!

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 103
dialogues.text: He then jumps out into the open and ROLLS under a TRUCK a bullets rain down on him. The EXPENDABLES lay down ground cover. HALE CAESAR’S remarkable WEAPON has the enemy temporarily in retreat. T ROAD takes a shot in the FOREARM.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: In the distance, he sees SANDRA, MONROE and PAINE fleeing he prepares to blow the building, MACHINE GUN FIRE kicks wall of dirt and gravel that knocks the DETONATOR from hi hand temporarily blinding him. A RED BERET has BARNEY in sights.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Seeing this, he jumps from his concealment, blowing the B away.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Claws his way to the DETONATOR and presses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE, SANDRA, PAINE are cleared of the building when th EXPLOSIONS nearly knock them off their feet.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE EXPLOSIONS
dialogues.text: The PALACE is being blown up in sections. Tons of MORTAR crumble straight down into smoking piles of RUBBLE.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE ENTRY
dialogues.text: Still dragging SANDRA, MONROE and PAINE move cautiously towards the HELICOPTER.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPENDABLES
dialogues.text: rush to a better vantage point and commence to unleash al their fire power on the ENEMY.  254

dialogues.speaker: EXPLOSIONS
dialogues.text: Behind the attacking ‘EXPENDABLES,’ we see the PALACE bei literally dissected by surgical-like detonations. The powerful SEARCHLIGHTS that sit atop the ornate building buckle then pitch forward.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: shoots out one of the LIGHTS and the TWO SOLDIERS beside The COURTYARD is nearly enveloped in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: With his .45 CAL PISTOL he cuts down TWO SOLDIERS as he sprints for cover behind arches along the COURTYARD WALL. OTHER SOLDIERS flank him, but are blasted away by YANG.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: With BLADES whirling, MONROE makes his way toward the machine.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: aims high along the COURTYARD and picks off a PAIR of SOLDIERS, that are manning a MACHINE GUN. A GRANADE lands his feet. With cat-like grace, he scoops it up and heaves at the CHOPPER.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Rolls beneath the TROOP TRUCK and fires at a GROUP of SOLDIERS who are using the vehicle for cover. FOUR TROOPS drop to the ground in agony. CHRISTMAS pulls the PIN on a GRENADE and rolls away from the TRUCK, which explodes sky high, landing on TWO fleeing SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The GRANADE blows the CHOPPER to pieces.  260 261

dialogues.speaker: PALACE
dialogues.text: The structure continues to implode as the lethal charges continue to erupt, sending tons of DEBRIS straight down i piles of RUBBLE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: drags SANDRA behind a PILE of SMOLDERING DEBRIS that was a MILITARY VEHICLE. His eyes search wildly for an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: sees SANDRA being pulled away and fights his way in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Starts rythmically blasting the MILITARY VEHICLES, which explode in a fiery ball.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: throws a GRENADE at the GAS that flows along the FENCE. I erupts into a wall of hell as he rolls and takes out TWO BERETS with his AUTOMATIC RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: SANDRA and PAINE recoil from the flames and the EXPLOSION continue from OPPOSITE ENDS of the doomed PALACE.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY FENCE
dialogues.text: explodes in sections. SEVERAL SOLDIERS drop their WEAPONS flee.

dialogues.speaker: FIVE RED BERETS
dialogues.text: are caught in a CROSSFIRE set up by HALE CAESAR and BARNE who continues to aggressively pursue SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD TOWER
dialogues.text: C-4 CHARGES blow and the TOWERS crumble.  268 269 270 271

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: TWO RED BERETS try to flee from the WALL OF FIRE. TOLL RO catches them flush, blasting them back into the inferno.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA, MONROE AND PAINE
dialogues.text: remain huddled behind SMOLDERING DEBRIS.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Keep moving!

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: blasts TWO SOLDIERS, one of which crashes headlong into t FOUNTAIN, then blows up the FOUNTAIN with another blast.

dialogues.speaker: RED BERET
dialogues.text: catches a perfect angle of HALE CAESAR and shoots. TWO SL bury themselves into the big man’s VEST, spilling him to ground.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: God Damn!!! MONROE flees with SANDRA, trying to get one of the few remaining MILITARY VEHICLES.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: Out of AMMO, he lunges at a fleeing SOLDIER, smashing him the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ducking behind a corner in the COURTYARD WALL, he spins around and catches TWO SOLDIERS by surprise and plugs the both with his .45.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: A GROUP of beaten, terrified and cowardly SOLDIERS flee through the damaged GATES.  276 277

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Still down he targets the fuel dump and fires. The dump erupts into a hellacious fireball.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: THREE SOLDIERS are heading toward the GATE when he jumps with a .45 in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: Using his amazing kicking ability, coupled with the .45’s what seems no more than a split second, FOUR SOLDIERS are gone.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: A GRENADE explodes nearby. Dropping to one knee, he sees MONROE, PAINE and SANDRA dashing to another location.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA'S TOWER
dialogues.text: The explosions have run their course, but the TOWER is damaged though still standing. SEVERAL SOLDIERS are pinni down CAESAR. His WOUND is hampering his ability to move quickly. A SUPER WEAPON commences to blast away at the weakened structure. If it topples properly, it will bury the RED BERETS who have him pinned down.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE
dialogues.text: The explosive rounds are tearing the base of the building apart. The PALACE TOWER is beginning to tilt when the AMMO runs The dug in SOLDIERS now zero in for the kill. TOLL ROAD d into view as HALE CAESAR tosses the WEAPON to him and sla in a fresh drum of explosive AMMO.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 108
dialogues.text: TOLL ROAD blasts away and the PALACE TOWER collapses in a fury DEBRIS directly on top of the enemy SOLDIERS. The battle is over. The LAST REMAINING SOLDIERS flee into night, leaving the remains of the BURNING PALACE far behi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE frantically looks around for an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: This way! MONROE starts to move into the DARK AREA of the surroundi JUNGLE. Flames are at their backs.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: is in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE WOODS
dialogues.text: MONROE, SANDRA and PAINE are looking for an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Monroe! They all freeze and turn towards BARNEY who stands twenty yards in front of them. Paine immediately shoots and Barn manages to find safety behind a tree.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: hears the shots and heads off in that direction. PAINE fires several more times.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Paine) Stop firing! (to Barney) Step out or a bullet’s goes in her head. MONROE jams a GUN in SANDRA’S temple.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Don’t test me - Step out - Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY drops his WEAPON and steps out into the open. With a moment's hesitation, MONROE open fires, putting a BULLE into BARNEY'S LEFT SHOULDER crumbling him to the ground. SANDRA screams and tries to instinctively go to his aid, is yanked back by PAINE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You dumb bastard, I woulda paid double what the agency parasites paid you to stay away! BARNEY struggles up to one knee and manages to square off against his adversary.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You'd have to be very dumb if you thought I was gonna surrender to those parasites. I made all this work. My brains, my sweat and then they wanted me out. Why? Because I saw the big picture? While the parasites and her father saw life through a keyhole because they let emotions cloud judgement - Emotions are the fucking cancer of intelligence! BARNEY eyes SANDRA whose eyes glow with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (losing it) But we’re both mercenaries, we have no emotions, so why the hell’d you come after me?!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I didn’t come after you, sick bitch - I came after her! As MONROE jams his PISTOL against SANDRA’S HEAD, a HISSIN SOUND is heard. Paine stiffens and wheeling around, shows regular THROWING KNIFE buried in his back. PAINE fires wi into the smoke and darkness as CHRISTMAS rushes forward a heaves GUNNAR’S MASSIVE BOWIE KNIFE, which buries itself to the HILT in PAINE’S thick chest. As MONROE looks on in horror, Sandra swings her elbow into Monroe’s side, freei herself as Barney draws his hidden six shooter from the s of his back, and empties it in Monroe’s chest. YANG, TOLL ROAD and HALE CAESAR wearily approach from behind...SANDR approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We done here?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PINK REVISIONS 5/11/09 110
dialogues.text: BARNEY looks at his MEN and nods.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...Looks that way. SANDRA embraces him and the scene DISSOLVES to sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEAPLANE’S PROPS spin to life. SANDRA stands with BARNEY at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (handing over a folded piece of paper) The second account number’s mine - Maybe it’1ll help get things goin.’

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No, I can’t. You’ve done so much.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So have you - Gift for a gift - Take it.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (very emotional) Will you come back ever?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Can’t say, but I promise you'll always be near me. BARNEY smiles and hugs her. She gently kisses his face an prepares to move away.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (softly) ‘Tienes que encontrar un mujer que siempre se quedara despierto solo para verte dormir’ - Someday you will find a woman who’1ll be happy just to watch you sleep. He smiles and jogs towards the idling plane. SANDRA start turn, but is drawn back as the plane’s ENGINES roar to fu power. She wipes a tear away as the PLANE glides towards glorious sunrise that is ascending over the majestic hori

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: EXT. TOOL’S - NIGHT TOOL is completing tattooing the image of the drawing tak from SANDRA’S TRUCK on the inside of BARNEY'S RIGHT ARM. Music is playing.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Man, you’re stuck with her whether you like it or not - You cruisin’ that way again?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Nah, I went there for the wrong reason, left for the right ones - And how can I live without you.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Sick, but nice. TOOL’S GIRLFRIEND, CHEYENNE sits on one of the CHOPPERS strumming her newly painted GUITAR. HALE CAESAR is sittin the incredible SHOW CAR, smoking a CIGAR while moving to rhythm of the MUSIC rising from the car’s stereo. CHRISTMAS and LACY are shooting POOL against TOLL ROAD an YANG, who are not very good. YANG shoots.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Why’re you guys embarrassin’ yourselves in front of this lady? It’s sad.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Stop pickin’ on them. They’re trying. YANG strains to reach for a difficult shot causing both h feet to lift off the floor as he stretches across the POO TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yang, it’s not a bed, one foot on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (aiming) Please close his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Next time bring a ladder, Yang.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: You’re windin’ up his complex.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Yang) Want me to get you a parachute?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Please, just ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: (to Lacy) Maybe he’s mad ‘cause you’re having my child.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: That hurts. YANG sinks the ball. The FRONT DOOR opens and GUNNAR enters. HALE CAESAR sees first.

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR
dialogues.text: (rising) There’s a damn zombie in the house! Welcome, Brother. He goes towards him. CHRISTMAS, LACY, YANG and TOLL ROAD cease playing. GUNNAR almost appears shy as he stands nea BARNEY and TOOL, who’s completed tattooing.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Welcome back from the dead, Big man.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Yeah, feels good. CHRISTMAS removes GUNNAR’S LARGE KNIFE from resting on a STOOL near the POOL TABLE and heads towards BARNEY and GUNNAR. TOLL ROAD, que still in hand, steps up. Only YANG hangs back and continues to shoot pool alone.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Long story.

dialogues.speaker: TOLL ROAD
dialogues.text: (to Gunnar) How ya feelin’?

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Considerin’ he coulda killed me, lucky.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Luck, hell, his ego’s bigger then a gumbo chef’s ass, but he hits what he wants to hit.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Thanks for bringing me back.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Promise is a promise. TOOL’S GIRLFRIEND drifts next to him.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: Hey, Darlin,’ what’s new? CHRISTMAS steps over to GUNNAR. LACY’S at his side.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (handing over Gunnar’s knife) You might want it back -

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Thanks. Get a chance to use it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, came in handy, but the balance is a little off. (gesturing) Gunnar, this is my very nice but very homely girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: That’s sweet. (to Gunnar) Nice to meet you. GUNNAR notices YANG at the POOL TABLE. GUNNAR heads towar him. TOOL gestures to CHRISTMAS then pulls out his knife.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (to Cheyenne) Y’know Darlin’ I’m feelin’ terribly accurate at this moment. Hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Cheyenne) If you want to impress her, buy her some nice earrings instead.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (opens his knife) Fear’s a terrible thing. GUNNAR goes to YANG.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: ...-Hey, what can I say?

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: You weren't yourself.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Yeah, that wasn’t me - Sorry. GUNNAR extends his HAND. YANG takes it.

dialogues.speaker: YANG
dialogues.text: But I would’ve won.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (smiles) ...Never. TOOL and CHRISTMAS square off. TOOL is still baiting CHRISTMAS.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (to the group) Yo, Outcasts, gather ‘round ‘cause ya gonna see a grown man cry. (to Christmas) A hundred bucks and Kleenex to weep into.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Talk’s cheap.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (taking aim) Like my cologne - Darlin’, you never give up, never give in, a boy versin’ a man can never win. TOOL snaps forward and whips his knife with startling spe and it buries itself near HITLER’S CHEEK. CHRISTMAS shrugs as the onlookers emit a variety of ‘oohs and ‘ahs.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) That’s inspiring. (to Lacy) Inspirational. (to the boys) Even intimidatin...’ CHRISTMAS turns his back away from the target and starts pace away ever so slowly.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (recites) “There’s a dude known only as TOOL, Crazy, but the epitome of COOL.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS opens the parlor’s door and steps onto the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (still walking) “Good with a KNIFE, very bad with a

dialogues.speaker: WIFE,
dialogues.text: But braggin’ he'll beat me, wow, Cool Tool has to be a world class FOOL.” Now standing in the middle of the street, CHRISTMAS rapid whips around, and with incredible accuracy, whips his KNI directly into the center of HITLER’S face.

dialogues.speaker: TOOL
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Man, losing to a bad poet, that does hurt. TOOL gives him a hug. The room explodes with a cheer. CHRISTMAS and BARNEY exch smiles of mutual admiration. Suddenly a very loud hissing sound is heard and a massive BOWIE KNIFE soars across the room, hitting HITLER in the chest with such force, it splits the target completely in half. Stunned, everyone turns and faces GUNNAR, who looks terribly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Checkin’ the balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. We’1ll take it out of your pay. At that moment, HALE CAESAR turns up the music and the festive mood kicks in as we dissolve out of TOOL’S and in the street where the camera soars high above TOOL’S build and beyond. THE END.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: ALTERNATE ENDING may be: The EXPENDABLES leaving TOOL’S SOCIAL CLUB astride the incredible looking CHOPPERS and fading into the hot night air.
